Lore: Favored by ambitious Noxian aspirants, each strike is a calculated risk, a chance to rise through the ranks by any means necessary.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold on hit and bonus gold upon reaching 100 stacks, sacrificing the item.
DescriptionLore: A pact with a lesser greed spirit. For each foe struck, gain 1 silver. Once 100 silver is earned, the spirit consumes the item, granting the wielder a gem worth 300 silver.

Lore: Associated with the celestial realm of Targon, possibly used by mortals blessed with celestial power or even the Aspects themselves.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield after dealing champion damage, preventing damage.
DescriptionLore: The Time Chain has two ends. As an action, choose two targets to chain. The targets must make a DC 25 Wisdom save or be tethered by time. If either succeeds the save, neither are tethered. When you are able to tether two creatures, they're bound through the celestial realm and the chain disappears from the material plane, existing as a tether in the celestial realm. While a creature is bound, it cannot die if the other creature is alive. All magic performed by a bound creature is felt by its tethered partner, that can choose to immediately dispell it at any point during the duration of the magical effect.

Lore: Commonly used by ambitious Noxian mages, seeking to amplify their power through dark pacts and esoteric knowledge.
DescriptionGame: Grants Ability Power and Mana. Stacks bonus Ability Power on champion kill or assist. Loses stacks on death.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells, maximum +10. On a kill, gain +2 temporary hp. Upon death, lose all bonuses and suffer -1 to hit for 1d4 turns.

Lore: Favored by novice duelists in Demacia, it is a simple but effective blade. Used often by young soldiers in training exercises.
DescriptionGame: Provides attack damage, health, and lifesteal, enhancing early-game combat.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to hit, +1 to damage. On a critical hit, heal 1d4 hit points. Breaks if wielder is reduced to 0 hit points in a single blow.

Lore: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers, its protective qualities are well-regarded. Some suspect Galio's magic is infused, granting the bearer tenacity.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and damage reduction from champion attacks.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +8 hit points and regenerates 1 hit point per turn. Reduce damage from targeted attacks by 1, stacks up to 2 times. Shield Crumbles if wearer is Evil Alignment.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, it whispers tales of forgotten iceborn warriors and their relentless battles against the void.
DescriptionGame: +150 Health, +10 Attack Damage, 10% Life Steal.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit when HP is below 50%. Whenever you deal the killing blow on an enemy, heal 1d4 HP.

Lore: This orb may be tied to ancient Ionian spirit magic, possibly used to protect against malevolent entities or channel inner power.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power, health, and mana. Taking damage grants a shield.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus magical attacks. If damage would reduce the wearer to 0 hit points or less, they are instead reduced to 1d4 hit points and gain temporary AC 18 for 1 round.

Lore: Associated with Ixtal's control over elemental magic and its protective stance, shielding the region from outside threats.
DescriptionGame: Provides a shield and tenacity after using a bush.
DescriptionLore: User gains +2 to AC and saves vs. fear for 1d4 rounds after contact with natural foliage.

Lore: Often found near places of great celestial influence, this tear resonates with the magic of the Aspects and the stars.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus mana and mana regeneration, scaling with mana spent.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells. Each spell cast imposes a cumulative -1 penalty to subsequent castings until a short rest, then penalty resets.

Lore: A popular drink amongst the hardy folk, rumored to contain a secret blend of frost berries and melted glacier ice. Associated with the Winter's Claw tribe.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and grants temporary movement speed boost.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing it heals 1d6 hp and grants +1 to Move rolls for 3 turns. Chance of frostbite if consumed in warm climates: take 1 cold damage per turn.

Lore: Favored by Noxian siege engineers and frontline soldiers, it grants size and resilience. Could be associated with the Black Rose through magical augmentation.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased size, tenacity, and damage reduction against champions.
DescriptionLore: Drink and grow mighty as an Ogre! But the concoction is unstable. Roll a d6, on a 1, suffer permanent size increase after the draught wears off! On a 6, shrink uncontrollably!

Lore: Favored by arena combatants and bloodthirsty warlords seeking an edge in battle. Often used in the fighting pits of Noxus.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, spell vamp, and empowers basic attacks on hit.
DescriptionLore: Upon consumption, grants +2 to hit and damage rolls. On a critical hit, regain 1d4 hit points. Lasts 5 turns. Afterwards, suffer -1 to hit rolls for 1 turn.

Lore: Commonly used by wandering monks and martial artists in Ionia to recover from strenuous training and meditation. Also popular among assassins.
DescriptionGame: Restores Health over time. Refills at the fountain.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing this potion restores 1d6 hit points over 3 rounds. The vial refills with use, but only in areas of natural power. (Example: Sacred Groves)

Lore: Used by sentinels to sweep for the Black Mist. It reveals hidden dangers and wards off the spectral tendrils of the Ruination.
DescriptionGame: Temporarily reveals invisible enemy units and disables enemy wards. Useful for scouting and clearing vision.
DescriptionLore: Grants the user brief glimpses into the ethereal plane, revealing hidden creatures and magical sigils. Grants advantage on saves vs. illusions and enchantments.

Lore: Likely brewed by a Bilgewater alchemist, exploiting vulnerabilities for profit. Associated with the unscrupulous underworld.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus gold on hit but reduces damage dealt to champions.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1d4 gold per successful attack, but imposes a -1 penalty to hit rolls against formidable foes. Represents a risky gamble for short-term gains.

Lore: Brewed by monks in remote monasteries, it is said to unlock hidden potential within the imbiber. It may be connected to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus true damage and increased ability power.
DescriptionLore: Upon imbibing, the character must immediately roll a saving throw (Wisdom). On a success, +1 to cast spells and damage, bypassing armour. On a failure, summon a chaotic extra-planar entity.

Lore: Poro-Snax are a Freljord delicacy, irresistibly delicious to Poros, the fluffy creatures of the Howling Abyss. Legends say they contain magical warmth.
DescriptionGame: Feeds a Poro, causing it to grow larger and grant a temporary visual effect.
DescriptionLore: A handful of Snax charms any beast, and may ward off the chill of a magical blizzard. Consuming a whole bag grants temporary advantage on saves vs. cold damage.

Lore: Baked by a famed Demacian baker. It's rumored to have been blessed by a mage to keep soldiers going during long campaigns.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and mana upon consumption.
DescriptionLore: When consumed, heals 2d8 hit points and removes one level of exhaustion. This biscuit never spoils and can sustain one lost in the wild.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena combatants, these greaves enhance speed, essential for dodging brutal attacks and exploiting fleeting openings in battle.
DescriptionGame: Increases attack speed and grants a moderate amount of movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to initiative and attack rolls. Movement in combat is doubled. Upon a failed save vs. magic, wearer flies into a berserker rage.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks and messengers, these boots whisper of haste and a light step, essential for traversing vast landscapes.
DescriptionGame: Increases movement speed and reduces the effect of slows.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves swiftly (+2 to Move silently checks, +2 to Run checks) and suffers less hindrance from binding magic or terrain.

Lore: Favored by Noxian battlemages, the treads are rumored to have been enchanted by a forgotten hemomancer of the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Reduces the duration of stuns, slows, taunts, fears, silences, blinds, polymorphs, and immobilizes. Grants magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Wearer saves against spells and enchantments with a +2 bonus. Furthermore, wearer is resistant to mind-altering effects, such as fear or charm, but is slightly more susceptible to poison damage.

Lore: Favored by Noxian mages and artificers, enhancing arcane power through specialized construction. Often seen in the Black Rose's inner circles.
DescriptionGame: Increases magic penetration, allowing spells to deal more damage by bypassing enemy magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Wearer's spells ignore some magical defenses. Reduce the target's effective MR by 1 for every 3 levels of the caster. Against creatures with no MR, spells instead inflict +1 damage per die rolled.

Lore: Potentially crafted by monks seeking harmony, reflecting Ionian spiritual beliefs. Could be tied to the Spirit Blossom festival.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus Ability Power and Haste, shared with a linked ally, empowering both champions.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to cast spells. If your linked ally is within 30', both gain +2 to cast spells, and any damage they take is reduced by 1. Be careful of range.

Lore: Associated with the spirit magic traditions of Ionia, often used by novice mages to enhance their connection to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants additional Ability Power, increasing the strength of spells and magical abilities.
DescriptionLore: Those who read from the tome find their spells cast for +1 damage die. But if a 1 is rolled, the spell fizzles as a wild surge.

Lore: Favored by Ionian mages, the wand amplifies the wielder's connection to the spirit realm, enhancing their spells.
DescriptionGame: Grants +40 Ability Power, increasing the damage of magical abilities.
DescriptionLore: When held, caster level is increased by 1 for purposes of spell damage. Wild magic surges are slightly more likely.

Lore: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers for basic protection. Often enchanted by mages to enhance its defensive capabilities.
DescriptionGame: Grants a small amount of armor, reducing physical damage taken from enemy attacks.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 AC vs. bludgeoning and slashing attacks. Armor Penalty applies unless STR 13+. If the wearer is attacked by surprise, this armor provides no benefit.

Lore: Often enchanted by Ionian monks, the Faerie Charm is thought to be infused with the essence of the spirit realm, aiding in meditation.
DescriptionGame: Provides mana regeneration.
DescriptionLore: The bearer regenerates 1 MP per turn in addition to their normal regeneration. Advantage on saving throws vs. magical exhaustion. Detect magic emanates from the charm.

Lore: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers, the Long Sword is a symbol of martial readiness and basic combat training within the kingdom.
DescriptionGame: Provides a small amount of attack damage, increasing physical damage output.
DescriptionLore: A Long Sword grants +1 to hit. On a roll of natural 20, wielder inflicts +1 damage. Weapon can be broken on an additional damage die roll.

Lore: Commonly enchanted by magesmiths across Demacia to protect soldiers from rogue mages, or the magic of the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resistance, reducing damage taken from enemy abilities.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to saves vs. spells and magical effects. If save succeeds, reduce damage by half. May glow faintly in the presence of powerful magic.

Lore: Often found near ancient wells, rumored to be blessed by the Ice Witch, granting resilience to those who carry them.
DescriptionGame: Passively grants health regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals 1 hit point per turn. If dropped into potable water, the well or stream heals 1d4 hit points to all creatures within 30 feet when imbibed.

Lore: Often used by aspiring mages and celestial beings, channeling the power of the stars to enhance their arcane abilities, especially those associated with mana.
DescriptionGame: Grants additional mana, increasing the capacity for spellcasting and ability usage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +4 to WIL saves vs. magical effects. On a successful save vs. a mana draining attack, gain 1d4 mana points. If the wearer has no mana, they can cast a single spell.

Lore: Whispers say Aether Wisps are fragments of spirit magic, drawn to places of power or strong emotion within Ionia.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed. Passive effect.
DescriptionLore: Bestows fleetness of foot. The wielder's movement is subtly enhanced; chance to outrun foes or catch distant prey improves by 10%.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian artisans, this mirror reflects inner magic, enhancing connection to the spirit realm. Could be associated with the Kinkou Order.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability haste, mana regeneration, and amplifies healing and shielding power.
DescriptionLore: Upon gazing, caster gains +1 to cast 'Healing' or 'Charm' spells for (level) turns. Must save vs. WIS or be compelled to reveal darkest secret.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena masters. Barbed armor punishes attackers, reflecting the brutal nature of gladiatorial combat.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage to attackers and applies Grievous Wounds to them for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Upon taking damage from a melee attack, the attacker suffers 1d4 damage. If the attack deals piercing or slashing damage, the attacker must make a saving throw or suffer disadvantage on their next attack.

Lore: Favored by Demacian smiths, the Warhammer is a symbol of craftsmanship and martial prowess, often carried by elite soldiers and artisans alike.
DescriptionGame: Provides attack damage and ability haste, enabling more frequent spell casts and stronger basic attacks.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to hit and damage. Once per day, reroll a failed attack roll. User suffers -1 to charisma checks when wielding (it's intimidating!).

Lore: Forged with True Ice, it's favored by hardy souls battling the elements and those who value resilience above all else.
DescriptionGame: Increases health and health regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus cold damage and recovers 1d4 hit points after each turn in frigid environments. If broken, may unleash a localized blizzard.

Lore: Potentially linked to ancient Ascended rituals, granting sight beyond mortal limits. Whispers of Azir echo in its embers.
DescriptionGame: Dealing damage burns enemies, revealing them if they are camouflaged or invisible.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck by fire must Save vs. Wisdom or be outlined in spectral fire, visible even through solid objects or magical darkness for 1d4 rounds. Camouflaged creatures are automatically revealed.

Lore: Said to be blessed by ancient spirits of Ionia, this idol is revered for its ability to amplify life energies and connect individuals to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Increases base mana regeneration and heal and shield power.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to all saving throws vs. spells and magical effects. Once per day, the wearer can attempt to turn undead as a cleric of equal level.

Lore: Forged with ice magic, rumored to have originated with the Iceborn. Grants resilience against physical attacks.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor and mana, reduces cooldowns of abilities.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 AC. Those who strike you in melee must SAVE vs. CON 14 or be slowed for 1 round as frost clings to their weapon.

Lore: Crafted by a forgotten Freljordian tribe, it was used by warriors known for chasing down enemies. Bears faint whispers of ancient hunts.
DescriptionGame: Move speed when near enemies. Gain more move speed when hitting an enemy with an attack.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to chase rolls. On a successful hit, the target must save vs. speed or be slowed (disadvantage on speed-based checks) for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Potentially linked to the techmaturgical advancements of Clan Lito or other Ionian inventors seeking to harmonize magic with technology.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus magic damage on your next attack after moving.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 on a damage roll after moving at least 10ft during the current turn. Requires attunement by a character with the 'tinker' or 'mage' class.

Lore: Favored by Noxian generals, the Last Whisper ensures their decrees cut through any resistance, solidifying their dominion through force and fear.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor penetration, allowing attacks to bypass a portion of the target's armor.
DescriptionLore: Ignores AC. Roll 1d6; on a 6, target's armor permanently degrades by 1 AC due to unseen corrosive whispers.

Lore: Associated with the celestial realm of Targon, offering protection against the void's corrupting influence or the madness of the abyss.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resistance, reducing damage from magical sources.
DescriptionLore: Grants +3 to saves vs. spells and spell-like effects. Wearer ignores the first magical attack each encounter (nullified).

Lore: Associated with forgotten magics of the Shadow Isles, possibly linked to Mordekaiser's empire or the Black Mist's corruption.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic penetration. Applies Grievous Wounds on dealing magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Renders the target vulnerable to magic, inflicting festering wounds that resist healing. Save versus magic or take -1 to future saves until healed magically.

Lore: Crafted with Ionian spirit magic, rumored to have been developed to resist Noxian enchantments during their invasion.
DescriptionGame: Removes all crowd control effects from your champion. Grants magic resist.
DescriptionLore: Grants +3 to saves versus spells and illusions. Once per day, the wearer can automatically succeed on a saving throw against an enchantment or binding spell.

Lore: Favored by Ionian archers, enhancing precision and speed. Often used in the defense of sacred groves against Noxian invaders.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack speed.
DescriptionLore: Ranged attacks deal +1 damage, and you may fire one additional arrow each round. Requires proficiency with bows. Crafted from enchanted wood.

Lore: Commonly used by Demacian scouts, these slingshots are known for their accuracy and reliability in the field. Encourages youthful courage.
DescriptionGame: Damages a champion from range and grants a small burst of movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, hurl a stone with unnatural accuracy. If it hits, briefly gain +2 to your next Agility check to escape or pursue.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins and spies, the Serrated Dirk is a tool of treachery and swift, silent kills. Often associated with the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Grants Lethality (armor penetration) and bonus attack damage.
DescriptionLore: Creature struck must save versus Death or suffer -1 to AC for 1d4 turns. On a hit, next attack roll against target gains +2.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, Sheen is rumored to be imbued with the strength of petricite, briefly amplifying the wielder's power after spellcasting.
DescriptionGame: After using an ability, the next attack deals bonus magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting a spell, your next successful hit gains +1 to hit and deals +1d6 elemental damage. Effect fades quickly; use or lose.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, the sigil represents unbreakable resolve, and defense against magic. It may be tied to the Petricite forests.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor and magic resist, enhancing survivability against physical and magical damage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to AC against mundane attacks and advantage on saves versus spells. Furthermore, the sigil negates the first magical attack each day. The sigil crumbles after negating 3 magical attacks.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, Tiamat whispers promises of destruction, rumored to amplify the bloodlust of its wielder, pushing them towards brutal, overwhelming force.
DescriptionGame: Deals area of effect damage around the wielder on each attack, amplifying the damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Upon a hit, unleash a shockwave (3d6 damage) to all within 5'. Save vs. STR to halve. Continued use corrupts, causing savage urges. On a failed WIS save, attack nearest ally.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the scepter draws strength from struck foes, embodying the empire's brutal and opportunistic nature.
DescriptionGame: Grants lifesteal, restoring health based on damage dealt to enemies.
DescriptionLore: Drain 8 hit points from a foe when you hit them with a melee attack. These hit points are added to yours, not exceeding your maximum.

Lore: Favored by Demacian sentinels. It is said to be blessed by the Mountain King to make the wearer immovable.
DescriptionGame: Reduces damage from basic attacks and reduces the attacker's attack speed.
DescriptionLore: Wearer takes -1 damage from bludgeoning attacks. Foes suffer -2 on attack rolls after striking the wearer for one round.

Lore: Favored by Lunari warriors. Provides speed and resilience.
DescriptionGame: Provides bonus movement speed and health.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to Move Silently in moonlight. Once per day, add +1 to AC vs. ranged attacks if under the open sky.

Lore: Whispers say it was forged in the Freljord's coldest depths, resonating with ancient watchers and forgotten ice magic.
DescriptionGame: Reduces magic resist of nearby enemies and increases magic damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Creatures within 20' suffer -2 to saves vs. magic. The wearer's spells inflict +1 damage per die rolled. A chilling aura permeates the area.

Lore: Favored by support champions, particularly those who can heal or shield allies, implying a connection to celestial beings or protectors.
DescriptionGame: Heals and shields on allies grant them increased attack speed and on-hit damage for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Upon shielding an ally, their attacks land with supernatural speed, dealing +1 damage. If target is undead, inflict +1d4 radiant damage. User may suffer temporary blindness after use (1 in 6 chance).

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and protective enchantments used to ward against its influence.
DescriptionGame: Grants a spell shield that blocks the next enemy ability.
DescriptionLore: Blocks one hostile spell. Duration until triggered. Save versus magic each dawn or the veil fades, losing its effect. If the spell would cause permanent damage, the Veil is destroyed.

Lore: Linked to forgotten rituals of the Shadow Isles, amplifying the user's magic at the cost of their life force. Perhaps Mordekaiser had a use for it.
DescriptionGame: Increases magic damage dealt, but damages the user each time they cast an ability.
DescriptionLore: Curse: user's spells do +1d6 dmg. On a cast, user loses 1d4 hp. If reduced to 0 hp via this item, the user is trapped in the Shadow Isles.

Lore: Potentially created by a Hemomancer in service to Noxus, it feeds on the life force of its victims.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and heals the wielder based on damage dealt. Healing is reduced against minions.
DescriptionLore: Upon a critical hit, the target must Save vs Death or lose 1d4 HP each round. The wielder gains an equal amount as temporary HP, fading after one turn.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the Bloodthirster is rumored to be quenched with the essence of fallen foes, empowering its wielder.
DescriptionGame: Grants lifesteal and overhealing, converting excess healing into a shield.
DescriptionLore: Heal one hp per successful attack. If you are at full health gain +1 AC until you take damage. Upon reaching 0 hp, the shield absorbs the blow, negating damage and disappearing.

Lore: Associated with the celestial entities of Mount Targon, possibly used by mortals blessed with celestial power or even the Aspects themselves.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield after dealing champion damage, preventing damage.
DescriptionLore: Negates the next source of damage. Save versus Magic or be immune to the next attack, spell, or hazard. Usable once per dawn.

Lore: Associated with celestial beings and cosmic energies from Mount Targon. Enhances movement and magical abilities.
DescriptionGame: Grants Ability Power, Health, and Haste. Empowers movement speed upon damaging champions with abilities.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to cast spells. After casting a spell, the wearer may move up to their level in feet without provoking attacks of opportunity. This effect lasts for one round.

Lore: Associated with celestial beings and cosmic energies, potentially linked to the Aspect of Twilight or the Celestial Dragon.
DescriptionGame: Increases ability haste, mana regeneration, and healing and shielding power.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to all Saving Throws against magical effects. Once per day, heal an ally for 1d8 hit points or grant them advantage on their next saving throw.

Lore: Favored by Noxian duelists, Death's Dance rewards aggression and resilience in battle, embodying the empire's ethos of strength through conflict.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage over time, heals on takedowns, and reduces incoming damage.
DescriptionLore: Wounds fester slowly. Upon slaying a foe, regain 1d6 hit points. Incoming damage is lessened, but transferred to a creeping doom. Save versus poison each round or lose 1 hp.

Lore: May be tied to the celestial aspects or a forgotten Targonian deity focused on healing and the balance of life energies.
DescriptionGame: Grants damage and healing based on recent damage dealt. Healing empowers your next damage dealing ability.
DescriptionLore: Heal a nearby ally, then imbue yourself with the Echo. Next strike deals +1d6 radiant damage. If no ally is near, deal 1d4 damage to yourself.

Lore: Favored by assassins and spies, its veil of darkness aids those who prefer to strike from the shadows, concealing their intentions.
DescriptionGame: Grants a spell shield that blocks the next enemy ability.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, the wearer can invoke a magical barrier, negating a single hostile spell or effect. The barrier shatters, leaving the wearer vulnerable.

Lore: Associated with Viktor's experiments and the Glorious Evolution. Could be a prototype created for the Mechanized Infantry.
DescriptionGame: Gain attack speed and empowers your next attack with bonus damage and a slow.
DescriptionLore: The wearer gains +3 to hit. On a successful attack, deal +1d6 damage and the target must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.

Lore: Said to be blessed by ancient spirits of the Freljord, the Force of Nature resonates with the land's raw, untamed power.
DescriptionGame: Absorbs incoming magic damage, granting movement speed and reducing future magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. magic. On a failed save, reduce damage by 2, gain +10' movement for 1 round. Upon taking magical damage, the wearer reflects 1d4 force damage.

Lore: Forged by Demacian artisans, rumored to contain a captured spirit, offering protection to its wearer in times of dire need.
DescriptionGame: Revives wearer upon death with a portion of health and mana after a delay.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, when reduced to 0 hit points, wearer returns to 50% hit points, but is stunned for 1 round as the spirit attempts to fully take over. Save versus WIS or alignment slowly changes.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be linked with ancient Frostguard rituals and imbued with the strength of long-forgotten ice giants.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and charges an attack to deal bonus damage based on maximum health.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to CON. Once per day, may unleash a devastating blow dealing extra damage equal to their current HP, but suffer 1d6 damage per 10 HP lost.

Lore: Whispers say it resonates with ruined souls, offering warmth, yet promising oblivion. A twisted beacon in the mist.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies and reduces damage taken from attacks.
DescriptionLore: Creatures near the wielder take 1d4 damage each round from eerie heat. The wearer gains +1 to AC versus physical attacks, but undead attack at +1 to hit.

Lore: A monument to pride, perhaps tied to the Immortal Bastion. Champions who gain power through notoriety or conquest might be drawn to it.
DescriptionGame: Grants AD. Kills create a statue; takedowns empower it, granting more AD. Statue expires on death, losing AD.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a worthy foe, gain +1 to hit and damage. Upon death, lose all bonuses, and enemies gain +1 to hit against you. A fitting monument may be erected to avoid complete disgrace.

Lore: Favored by frost mages and warriors, the Iceborn Gauntlet channels the chill of the Freljord, offering protection and control over the battlefield.
DescriptionGame: Empowers auto attacks to create an icy zone that slows enemies.
DescriptionLore: Upon a hit, target must Save vs. Cold or be Slowed (as per the Slow spell). Furthermore, the ground touched becomes icy and treacherous, requiring a Save vs. Falling each round to avoid being prone.

Lore: Favored by warlords, it amplifies damage when allies strike those you've impaired, reflecting Noxian ambition and brutal efficiency.
DescriptionGame: Immobilizing a champion marks them, dealing bonus damage and empowering allies' damage against the marked target.
DescriptionLore: Upon a hit, declare one target vulnerable. Allies gain +1 to hit and damage rolls against the vulnerable target for 1 round. Target saves vs. spell or suffers -1 to all saves for 1 round.

Lore: Forged in a lost age of Shurima, it whispers of resisting the Void and adapting to any threat. Perhaps tied to the Ascended.
DescriptionGame: Grants stacking resists. At max stacks, empowers you for damage and even more resists.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 AC per round of combat, to a max of +6. Upon reaching +6, wreathes the wearer in dark energy dealing 1d6 necrotic damage to all adjacent creatures on the wearer's turn. AC bonus resets to 0 after combat.

Lore: Knights Vow is tied to Demacia's ideals of protection and sacrifice, embodying the unwavering loyalty of its warriors, perhaps Garen or Jarvan IV.
DescriptionGame: Redirects damage from an ally to the wearer, healing based on damage dealt. Grants bonus armor while near the ally.
DescriptionLore: Target ally is blessed, taking 1d4 less damage, transferred to the vow-bearer. The vow-bearer heals 1hp per point of damage they deal while the vow remains. While near the ally, +1 AC.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and the Ruination, embodying lingering torment and agony.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus magic damage over time, amplified against slowed or immobilized enemies.
DescriptionLore: Inflicts Agony (save vs. Will or take 1d4 damage/round). Agony intensifies against those Hindered or Bound, doubling the damage. Upon death, the Agony transfers to the nearest living creature.

Lore: Forged with celestial power on Mount Targon, it resonates with the strength of the sun and protects against the encroaching darkness.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resist and an AoE shield to protect allies from incoming damage.
DescriptionLore: Bestows a ward against malign spirits. Grants +2 to saves vs. spells for the wearer and those within 30'. Lasts 3 turns. Usable once per day.

Lore: Associated with the ancient Rune Mage, Luden, amplifying magical abilities and arcane echoes within Ionia.
DescriptionGame: Damaging abilities grant charges. At max charges, the next damaging ability consumes all charges to deal bonus damage to the target and nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting, roll +INT. On a 10+, unleash a magical barrage dealing 1d6 force damage to all creatures within 10ft.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, the Manamune is believed to be connected to the spirit realm, amplifying the wielder's inner energies into potent attacks.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus damage based on mana. Converts mana to attack damage and restores mana on hit.
DescriptionLore: Wielder's attacks deal +1d4 force damage for every 10 points of mana. On a hit, restore 1 mana; if mana is full, +1 temporary hit point instead. Breaks if mana ever reaches 0.

Lore: Mejai's Soulstealer is likely connected to dark magic practiced in Noxus or learned from the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Grants Ability Power upon champion kills and assists, up to a cap. AP is lost upon death.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to cast dangerous magics. For each foe slain, gain +1 to hit with any magic attack, maximum +25. Upon death, lose all bonuses and roll on the mishap table.

Lore: Associated with the aspect of protection, embodying resilience against malevolent forces. Connected to celestial beings watching over Runeterra.
DescriptionGame: Removes all crowd control effects from an ally and grants them temporary immunity to disables.
DescriptionLore: Touch a creature to instantly remove paralysis, sleep, or charm. Furthermore, the target saves against all further such effects for the next turn.

Lore: Associated with forbidden Noxian magics and necromancy, potentially linked to dark arts practiced in the empire's underbelly.
DescriptionGame: Applies Grievous Wounds to enemies hit by abilities, reducing healing.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck by magic from this tome suffer -2 on all saves vs. death magic and healing spells restore only half HP. Undead take double damage.

Lore: Linked to Ryze and the World Runes, resonating with immense magical power and potential.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus damage and mana-based scaling on-hit and with abilities.
DescriptionLore: Upon attunement, weapon deals +1d6 force damage. Expend mana (1 point) to deal +1d6 force damage with an attack. Chance of attracting unwanted magical attention.

Lore: Associated with Ionian assassins seeking perfect form, possibly linked to the Spirit Blossom festival's transience.
DescriptionGame: Abilities reduce other ability cooldowns on-hit, empowering future casts.
DescriptionLore: Swift action to reduce next spellcasting time by 1 round. On critical, caster may Disappear as per the spell, but lasts only 1 round (1-in-6 chance each round).

Lore: Forged in the forges of Noxus, rumored to be quenched in the blood of fallen enemies, possibly a favored item by Darius.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health, attack damage and size, increased damage based on missing health, and bonus healing.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 Hit Points. When below half HP, do +1 damage. When HP is critical, do +2. Chance to instill fear in weaker foes. Requires attunement and a Strength score of 13.

Lore: Crafted in Noxus, it whispers promises of dominance, potentially tied to blood magic or the Crimson Circle.
DescriptionGame: Deals AoE damage around the user and empowers the next attack to deal more damage to low health enemies.
DescriptionLore: Strike the ground to deal 2d6 damage to all within 10ft (save for half). Next attack deals +1d8 damage and, if target is below 25% HP, they must save vs. death or die instantly.

Lore: Crafted by the Iceborn of the Freljord, it is said to ward off the most savage blows.
DescriptionGame: Reduces damage from attacks and slows nearby attackers.
DescriptionLore: Grants a 1-in-6 chance to negate any physical blow. On a failed save, attackers within melee range must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be slowed (attacks made at -2 penalty) for 1 round.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian warriors. It is rumored to have been wielded by powerful warlords, amplifying their destructive potential in battle.
DescriptionGame: Deals area of effect damage and grants lifesteal, enhancing sustain and wave clear.
DescriptionLore: Cleave: Enemies within 10' take 1d6 damage. Life Drain: User heals 1hp per successful attack. On a critical hit heal 1d4 in addition. Wielder must save vs. CHA or become blood thirsty (-1 to CHA rolls).

Lore: Implies a connection to hemomancy or the Black Rose, enhancing their life-draining magic and dark influence.
DescriptionGame: Damage is converted to true damage, and healing is granted based on damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage. On a hit, regain 1d4 hit points. Prolonged use turns flesh pallid; must SAVE vs DISEASE each day or lose 1d6 CON.

Lore: Crafted by an unknown Ionian smith, it is said to channel the storm's fury through multiple projectiles, embodying Ionian balance.
DescriptionGame: Fires bolts at nearby enemies on attack, dealing reduced damage but applying on-hit effects.
DescriptionLore: The wielder's attack splits, striking two additional targets within range. Each secondary strike deals less damage, but may inflict status effects.

Lore: Associated with celestial beings and immense magical power, rumored to be linked to the Aspect of Magic.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power, mana, and a shield based on mana.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells. Expend mana to create a shimmering shield, AC 16, absorbs 1d6 damage. Shield lasts 3 rounds.

Lore: Likely named after a Freljordian hero or ice witch, this weapon embodies the harsh, unforgiving nature of the frozen north and its tenacious inhabitants.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor penetration and slows enemies hit by abilities.
DescriptionLore: Attacks bypass armor as if it were ice. Upon being hit, enemies must Save vs. Cold or suffer -2 to movement speed for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Said to amplify the voices of Targonian Aspects, channeling celestial power into a harmonious battle cry.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed and empowering damage to nearby allies upon activation.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, emits a pulse. Allies gain +2 to initiative and deal +1 damage for the next round. Undead flee.

Lore: Forged by a Shojin monk, it amplifies inner strength. It is possibly related to the spirit realm and martial prowess of Ionia.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage, health, and ability haste. Abilities grant bonus movement speed and attack speed.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to hit and damage. After casting a spell, move more quickly and strike with supernatural speed for 6 seconds. Save versus WIS or be stunned for 1 round after spell cast.

Lore: Said to be imbued with the essence of a tranquil river spirit, favored by Ionian monks for meditation and empowering allies.
DescriptionGame: Heals or shields grant bonus Ability Power and Haste to the user and their ally.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting a spell that heals or protects, the target's next spell is empowered. The target can cast spells faster or produce a more powerful effect as determined by the GM.

Lore: Potentially crafted by a Demacian artisan for elite warriors, it symbolizes resilience and the will to endure even mortal wounds.
DescriptionGame: Provides a shield when taking heavy damage, and boosts size and strength.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 on saves vs. massive damage. Upon failing a save, briefly become giant-sized, gaining +1d6 to hit and damage for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Favored by Noxian warmasters, it allows brutal warriors to close the gap and deliver devastating blows. Associated with aggressive, conquering forces.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, while granting movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, user may move their speed x3. If the user attacks, all targets hit must save vs STR or be slowed for 1d4 turns. Damage inflicted is +1 die type.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Targon, it is associated with celestial beings, granting resilience in the face of overwhelming odds.
DescriptionGame: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies and enhances defensive stats.
DescriptionLore: Grants a constant aura of searing heat. Those nearby suffer 1d4 fire damage per round. User gains +2 to AC, and saves versus fire. Armor check penalty increased by 1.

Lore: Favored by those who extract a toll of blood and tears, The Collector is seen among the Black Rose's inner circle.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage, critical strike chance, and lethality. Executes enemies below a health threshold, granting bonus gold.
DescriptionLore: On a successful attack, the target must make a saving throw or be reduced to 0 HP if already below 5 HP. If the target dies, the wielder gains 1d4 gold.

Lore: Crafted from the remains of a monstrous sea creature, perhaps related to Nagakabouros or a powerful Kraken from the depths.
DescriptionGame: Deals additional damage based on the wielder's maximum health, amplified on subsequent attacks.
DescriptionLore: Upon a successful hit, make a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, push the target 1d4 x 5 feet and deal an additional 1d6 damage per point of Strength bonus.

Lore: A weapon favored by Demacian champions, rumored to be blessed by the ancient kings, enhancing the wielder's capabilities.
DescriptionGame: Provides balanced stats, empowering attacks with bonus damage, attack speed, and movement speed on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit: roll 1d6. 1-2: +1 to hit; 3-4: +1 damage; 5-6: +10' movement. Effects last until the end of your next turn.

Lore: The despair resonates with the Black Mist, amplifying the anguish of tormented spirits and spreading sorrow. Possibly linked to a powerful wraith.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage in an area and heals the wearer for a portion of the damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Wearer emits a 10' aura of despair. Those within suffer -1 to morale. Upon striking a foe, heal 1d4 HP. Undead within the aura are strengthened.

Lore: Said to be forged from the sands of the void itself. The staff hums with an unknown energy.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic penetration, increasing damage against enemies with magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Bypass magical wards and defenses as if they weren't there, channeling raw void energy to melt through enchantments. Save vs. Magic or be disintegrated.

Lore: Said to be forged in the ice, it is associated with great strength and endurance, possibly linked to ancient frost giants or Ornn's forge.
DescriptionGame: Passively grants health regeneration based on a percentage of maximum health and grants a large amount of health.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves versus exhaustion. If reduced to 0 hit points, heal 1d6 hp per round for the next 10 rounds. Must make a DC 15 CON save at the end, or gain one level of exhaustion.

Lore: Said to be forged in Ionia, the blade whispers false promises and subtle doubts, eroding the will of its victims.
DescriptionGame: On-hit magic damage and magic resist increase. At low health, further boosts magic resist.
DescriptionLore: Blade whispers, victim SAVES vs. WIS or takes -1d4 to hit and damage. Gain +1 AC vs. magical attacks. If HP < 25%, AC bonus becomes +3.

Lore: Favored by Ionian archers, rumored to be crafted with wood from the spirit realm, enhancing the wielder's connection to the land.
DescriptionGame: Empowers ranged attacks with bonus damage and increased critical strike chance against distant targets.
DescriptionLore: Ranged attacks deal +1d6 damage. On a critical hit, the target must Save vs. Magic or be rooted in place for 1 round. Usable by elves and humans.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, linked warriors enhance each other's power in battle. Often used by pairs of bloodsworn siblings.
DescriptionGame: Grants Armor, Magic Resist, Ability Haste and Mana. Casting your ultimate empowers your ally, granting them on-hit damage and slows enemies.
DescriptionLore: Bonds two warriors. When one casts a mighty spell, the other gains +1 to hit and deals +1d4 frost damage for 8 rounds. Foes struck are slowed (save vs. paralyze or 1 round penalty to initiative).

Lore: Bound to a chosen ally, granting mutual strength and protection. Represents a pact made with potentially dark consequences tied to the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionGame: Binds you to an ally, granting effects based on proximity. Grants damage and survivability based on the oath.
DescriptionLore: The spear binds the wielder to another; when near, both gain +1 to hit and damage. When the bound ally dies, the wielder must save vs. death or become a wraith.

Lore: Favored by the Buhru during Nagakabouros's rites. Some say prayers focused through it reach the Bearded Lady faster.
DescriptionGame: Temporarily grants bonus attack range and attack speed after using an ability.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, after casting a spell, the wielder's ranged attacks gain +1 to hit and +1 damage for the next round. Missed attacks curse the wielder for one round, causing -1 to hit.

Lore: Mimics the appearance of a scarecrow. Could be linked to Fiddlesticks, a primal demon.
DescriptionGame: Places a controllable hallucination that resembles you. If an enemy gets close, the hallucination vanishes.
DescriptionLore: Appears as a perfect, immobile double. Upon contact, it vanishes in a puff of smoke; target must SAVE vs. WIS or believe the player still stands there for 1d4 turns.

Lore: Turrets were likely enchanted by mages during the Rune Wars, a last bastion of defense during sieges.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus armor and magic resistance to turrets while nearby allies are present.
DescriptionLore: Turret becomes harder to hit with ranged attacks while allies stand near. Grants +2 AC versus ranged, only when allies are adjacent to the turret. If no allies are present, AC is reduced by 2.

Lore: Favored by winter hunters, enhancing their connection to the land and the hunt. Perhaps tied to a forgotten Ice Witch.
DescriptionGame: Empowers movement speed and damage after using an ability.
DescriptionLore: After casting a spell, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Movement is doubled, but armor class is reduced by 2.

Lore: The Overcharged item pulses with raw magical energy, reminiscent of Ionian spirit magic and potentially linked to the First Lands' ley lines.
DescriptionGame: Temporarily grants bonus movement speed and damage upon casting a spell.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, after casting a spell, the wielder moves with unnatural swiftness (+3 to Movement) and their next attack deals +1d6 damage. However, there is a 1-in-6 chance of magical feedback (take 1d4 damage).

Lore: Likely forged by Demacian armorers, possibly enchanted by mageseekers for defensive fortifications around the kingdom.
DescriptionGame: Greatly increases turret armor and magic resistance, reducing damage taken from champions.
DescriptionLore: Turret gains +3 AC, +2 to saves vs. magic. Ranged attacks against it suffer -2 penalty. When HP is reduced to 0, it becomes inert rubble.

Lore: Potentially developed by Demacian artificers to bolster their war efforts against foreign mechanized threats or the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield when taking damage below a health threshold; also grants size and damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, when reduced to 5 hit points or less, gain 3d6 temporary hit points. In addition, the wielder's size increases by one category, and melee attacks deal +1d4 damage for 1 round.

Lore: Said to be woven from captured starlight, favored by Lunari mystics seeking solace from the sun's glare.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resistance and reduces damage from area-of-effect abilities.
DescriptionLore: Advantage on saves vs. radiant damage and spells that affect an area. Wearer is immune to mundane blindness, but suffers disadvantage in direct sunlight.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, Cruelty is often seen in the arena, and is associated with might makes right.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage based on enemy health and grants bonus movement speed.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, deal +1d6 damage per HD of the target. If the target is slain, gain +1 to movement until the end of the encounter.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena fighters, this weapon is said to bring swift ends to even the most formidable foes. For the glory of Noxus!
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to low-health targets, ensuring a quick kill and preventing escapes.
DescriptionLore: On hit, a creature with less than 2 HD must save vs. Death Ray or be instantly slain. Otherwise, deals +1d4 damage.

Lore: Whispers claim it's linked to a forgotten Shadow Isles ritual, binding a spirit's essence to objects.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage over time and grants bonus armor and magic resist.
DescriptionLore: Curse a foe's body and soul with burning agony (1d4 damage per round, save vs. spell each round). Gain +1 AC and +1 to saves vs. magic.

Lore: Favored weapon of a forgotten ice tribe, tipped with a diamond formed under immense glacial pressure. Used to pierce the hearts of mammoths and gods alike.
DescriptionGame: +80 Attack Damage, +10% Critical Strike Chance, Unique Passive: Empowered attacks deal bonus damage and slow enemies.
DescriptionLore: On a successful hit, roll a d6. On a 5-6, the target must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (move at half speed) for 1 round. Against creatures of ice, the spear deals double damage.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a celestial dragon, Dragonheart is imbued with cosmic fire, resonating with the Solari faith atop Mount Targon.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration and armor, empowering the wearer with draconic resilience in battle.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to AC. When damaged, roll 1d6. On a 6, exhale a cone of fire (1d6 damage, save for half) once per day.

Lore: Potentially named after a renowned Demacian healer or saint, it symbolizes resilience and recovery against overwhelming odds.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, mana regeneration, and reduces crowd control duration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals 1d6 hp per turn and recovers from paralyzation, if save is made. Charm attempts suffer -2 penalty against wearer.

Lore: Potentially created by a Freljordian Ice Witch. Grants slowing and immobilizing effects, resembling Lissandra's magic.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage in a cone, slowing enemies. Immobilizes enemies in the center.
DescriptionLore: Cone of frost deals 3d6 cold damage, slowing (Save vs. magic to negate). Center target must Save vs. magic or be held fast, paralyzed by ice for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, the Force of Entropy embodies the empire's relentless pursuit of power, twisting magic to dominate foes.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage and grants movement speed when hitting enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, touch infuses the target with entropy. Save vs. Death or take 1d6 damage and move last next round. On subsequent hits, the entropy spreads, affecting another target.

Lore: The Galeforce is rumored to be crafted by ancient Ionian windspeakers, channeling storms into a single, deadly gust.
DescriptionGame: Active: Dash a short distance and fire projectiles at the nearest enemy.
DescriptionLore: Whistle and a roaring wind propels you. Save versus Wind or be blown 2d6 * 10' in a random direction. Attack at +4 after, dealing 1d6 wind damage.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, rumored to be infused with petricite, enhancing the wearer's resilience. Used by sentinels during the Ruination.
DescriptionGame: Increases armor and magic resist. Activate to gain a large shield, increased by nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to AC, but suffers -1 on DEX saves. Once per day, can turn to stone for 1d4 rounds, gaining +8 AC and advantage on STR checks.

Lore: Crafted by a forgotten Noxian hemomancer, it amplifies blood magic. Linked to dark pacts made in the empire's early days.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health and ability haste, amplifying healing and damage based on missing health.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to hit when bleeding, +4 if the target is also suffering blood loss. All blood magic spells gain +1 to cast.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies, rumored to resonate with the aspects of Targon, offering vitality and strength to its wielder.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability haste, magic resist, and health, while also reducing ultimate cooldown.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, wearer may re-roll any saving throw, accepting the second result. Grants advantage when resisting exhaustion.

Lore: Whispers say Volibear's followers craft these rods, believing they channel the storm's fury. Some bear faint claw marks.
DescriptionGame: Periodically emits chain lightning, damaging nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck by the rod's lightning must SAVE vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round. Rod discharges 3 times/day. User vulnerable to lightning.

Lore: Associated with the Lunari of Targon, harnessing lunar magic. Could be connected to champions like Diana or Aphelios.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resist and ability haste. Grants bonus movement speed after dealing spell damage.
DescriptionLore: Confers Advantage on saves vs. magical effects. Once per dawn, user may move at double speed for one turn after casting a spell.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, Prowler's Claw is linked to swift, brutal ambushes, embodying Noxus's aggressive military doctrine.
DescriptionGame: Dashes through enemies, dealing damage and increasing damage dealt for a short duration after the dash.
DescriptionLore: Grants the wearer one use of Dimension Door, but only to attack. After teleporting, the next attack deals +2 damage for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Immortal Bastion, rumored to be imbued with a fragment of a long-dead fire mage's soul.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies every second, increased damage to minions and monsters.
DescriptionLore: Creatures within 10' take 1d6 fire damage each round. Undead take double damage. Cloth and paper ignite instantly. Save versus fire or be set aflame for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies, it echoes the will of the Aspects, reshaping the world around the wielder. Associated with mountain forges.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage based on the target's current health and shreds armor.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, roll a d6. On a 6, permanently reduce their armor by 1. If armor reaches 0, the next attack deals double damage. Represents Celestial judgment.

Lore: A blade forged in the heart of Noxus, whispering promises of power to those who dare to seize the throne. Associated with Darius.
DescriptionGame: Gain bonus damage and movement speed after killing an enemy champion. Killing the champion with the highest killstreak grants additional bonuses.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a foe, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 turns. Slaying a 'king' (highest level creature) grants permanent +1 to charisma and advantage on saves vs. fear.

Lore: Ancient Freljordian magic, possibly tied to the Iceborn or forgotten rune mages, is imbued within the Runecarver's enchantments.
DescriptionGame: Empowers basic attacks with bonus damage and slows enemies. Periodically grants a shield after casting an ability.
DescriptionLore: Weapon deals +1d4 frost damage, slowing targets (Save vs. Paralysis). After casting a spell, gain 3 temp HP (1 round duration).

Lore: Forged in the heart of Mount Targon, rumored to have been touched by the fire of a fallen Aspect.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, armor, and a damage aura to nearby allies, while reducing damage taken.
DescriptionLore: Wearer becomes a beacon of resilience. Allies within 30' gain +1 AC and +1 on saves vs. fear. Incoming attacks are slightly less effective on the wearer.

Lore: Favored by those ascending Mount Targon, it is said to bear the protective blessings of the celestial peak, aiding pilgrims in their journey.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed, health regeneration, and cooldown reduction to nearby allies when activated.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, grants +1 to AC to the party within 30ft for 1d4 rounds. The talismanbearer must make a DC 13 Wisdom save or be compelled to move towards the nearest high peak.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, this blade channels twilight magic, granting temporary invisibility and armor penetration, aiding in covert operations.
DescriptionGame: Grants invisibility after using a dash or blink. The next attack deals bonus damage and reduces armor.
DescriptionLore: Upon command word, user vanishes into shadows for 1 round. First attack from shadows deals +1d6 damage and reduces target AC by 2 for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by assassins in the Leblanc's Black Rose cabal, this blade whispers secrets of shadow magic and swift strikes.
DescriptionGame: Grants lethality and movement speed, enhancing burst damage and mobility for assassins.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target saves vs. Death at -2 or age 1d4 years. Grants +2 to Surprise checks. On a miss, user is briefly visible to ethereal beings.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, imbued with celestial magic. Grants power to those who channel the stars, favored by the Aspect of Magic.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus ability power, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction. Empowers spells with celestial energy.
DescriptionLore: As a reaction, discharge a surge of celestial energy. Foes within 30' take 1d6 force damage per caster level; save for half. On a natural 1, the caster is stunned for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by ascetics seeking enlightenment, some say the items whisper guidance from beyond the stars, a gift from the celestial Aspect.
DescriptionGame: Provides gold and vision, enhancing support abilities and granting wards.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to Wisdom saves. Once per day, cast 'light'. Sacrifice a point of HP to see through the eyes of a distant creature, as per the 'clairvoyance' spell.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Mount Targon, imbuing the wielder with celestial power and the might of the Aspects.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus stats and an additional unique effect based on the equipped champion.
DescriptionLore: Upon attunement, roll a d6: 1-3 bestows a boon, 4-6 inflicts a curse. Boons are potent, curses dire. Cannot be removed except by a wish.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, these chains may bind even the mightiest foe, turning their own strength against them, a tool for assassins and duelists.
DescriptionGame: Designate a nemesis to take reduced damage from and deal less damage to your allies.
DescriptionLore: Curse a creature. They deal -1d4 on attack rolls against the party, and all damage they inflict on the wielder is halved. Save versus spell each dawn to break the chains.

Lore: Associated with Demacian military, possibly named after a revered general or hero known for resilience and tactical prowess.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage based on a percentage of maximum health, and armor.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit for every 10 hit points, and are considered AC 3 vs bludgeoning attacks. Upon dropping to 0 hp or below the wielder may chose to take a level of exhaustion to stay at 1 hp.

Lore: Harrowing relics from the Shadow Isles. Grants the wearer the ability to hunt souls.
DescriptionGame: Provides movement speed and bonus damage when near enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves at +50% speed toward undead. Deal +1d6 damage to corporeal undead, but suffer -1 on saves vs. incorporeal undead.

Lore: Favored by novice assassins in Noxus. Its dark steel may originate from a mine near the Immortal Bastion, known for imbuing weapons with lethal sharpness.
DescriptionGame: Grants lethality and attack damage. Passively grants bonus movement speed when out of combat.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage rolls against unaware foes. Move silently as a thief 7/10 in wild zones.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to have been used in dark rituals within the Immortal Bastion. Possibly tied to demonic pacts.
DescriptionGame: Increases magic damage and provides bonus health regeneration based on mana spent.
DescriptionLore: User's spells become infused with hellfire (1d6 fire damage). Spending mana heals 1hp, but risks demonic attention (GM roll on excessive use).

Lore: Associated with Ionian monks seeking enlightenment through heightened reflexes and spiritual clarity. Legends say it enhances connection with the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants temporary increased movement speed and attack speed.
DescriptionLore: Drink and for 1d4 rounds, double movement. Roll a d6. On a 1, the character is confused, believing they are fighting an old enemy.

Lore: Likely brewed by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, or perhaps a product of the Spirit Blossom festival's magic.
DescriptionGame: Restores a small amount of health and mana over a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Drink and recover 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana (or equivalent) over the next turn. There is a 1 in 6 chance of vivid hallucinations for 1d3 turns thereafter.

Lore: Whispers say it's tied to a forgotten Ionian spirit, capable of disrupting the minds of even the most disciplined monks.
DescriptionGame: Reduces the target's magic resistance and movement speed for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Creature suffers -2 to saves vs. mind-affecting spells and moves at half speed for 1d4 rounds. Save vs. Spells negates movement penalty.

Lore: Forged in the Shadow Isles, it whispers promises of power and oblivion, corrupting the wielder's soul.
DescriptionGame: Grants lifesteal and an active ability that slows enemies and steals their movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Wielder heals HP equal to damage dealt by melee attacks. Once per day, target must SAVE vs. Death or suffer -2 to movement for 1d4 rounds. If the SAVE is failed, wielder gains +2 movement for the same duration.

Lore: Crafted by a forgotten Ionian order, it resonates with the Spirit Blossom Festival, amplifying spiritual connections and ancestral echoes.
DescriptionGame: Heals allies and empowers attacks after casting your ultimate.
DescriptionLore: Upon uttering a prayer with this sword, restore 1d6 hit points to the nearest ally. For the next round, your attacks deal +1 damage and spirits whisper warnings, granting +1 to AC.

Lore: Favored by Ionian mages, rumored to enhance natural magic. Some believe it once belonged to a powerful spirit.
DescriptionGame: Grants Ability Power. Upon taking fatal damage, become untargetable and invulnerable for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to magic damage rolls. Once per day, when reduced to 0 hp, become ethereal for 1d4 rounds; attacks pass through, but wearer cannot act.

Lore: Said to resonate with the raw magic of the Freljord, amplifying the wielder's power and weakening magical defenses.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and reduces magic resist of nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Creatures within 20' suffer -2 to saves versus magic. Wielder gains +2 to saves versus magic, negating magic missiles outright on a successful save. A palpable hum emanates when near the magically sensitive.

Lore: Symbol of the Dauntless Vanguard, it bolsters nearby allies. Bearer is emboldened by a golden glow and gains unnatural resilience.
DescriptionGame: Nearby allies gain magic resist and armor. Grants the user bonus armor, magic resist, and ability haste.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to saves vs. spells and +1 AC to self and allies within 30'. Upon a critical failure, the Aegis shatters, losing its magical properties.

Lore: Likely originated in Shurima, where currency was tied to celestial favor and desert survival.
DescriptionGame: Periodically grants gold and mana upon nearby enemy minion death.
DescriptionLore: Upon receiving this coin, roll a d6. On a 1, attract unwanted spirits. On a 6, gain advantage on a future saving throw against starvation or thirst.

Lore: The Arcane Helix hums with Ionian spirit magic, resonating with the land's ancient energies and possibly influencing spirit blossom festivals.
DescriptionGame: Periodically empowers the next attack, dealing bonus magic damage and healing the user.
DescriptionLore: Heal 1d4 hp and deal 1d4 arcane damage on a successful melee attack. Must recharge for 1 turn after use, leaving you vulnerable.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the staff amplifies inner energies. It is rumored to resonate with the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants mana, ability power, and mana regeneration, converting mana into additional ability power.
DescriptionLore: The wielder's spells are louder and brighter. Failed spellcasting risks summoning an imp from the outer planes. Spending mana risks a point of fatigue.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial Aspect of Magic, granting its wielder immense magical power and spiritual insight.
DescriptionGame: Grants mana regen, AP, and MR. Provides bonus healing/shielding based on damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Wielder gains +2 to WIS saves vs. enchantment. Healing spells also grant a shield equal to damage dealt, but makes the wielder vulnerable to psychic attack if the target is evil.

Lore: Associated with the Black Rose, granting its user immense power, but at a terrible cost. Could be related to forbidden hemomancy rituals.
DescriptionGame: Increases ability power and grants bonus damage to low-health enemies, amplifying kill potential.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, if the target has less than 2 HD, they must save versus death or die. The wielder loses 1 max HP permanently after each usage.

Lore: Potentially created by a forgotten aspect of Targon, granting immense arcane power. It's linked to celestial beings enhancing mortals.
DescriptionGame: Abilities deal bonus damage. Grants Ability Power on champion level up. Provides bonus magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Grants the user temporary access to the celestial realm. 1-in-6 chance of attracting the attention of a powerful entity, resulting in a boon or a curse.

Lore: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used for meditation and healing rituals. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order or the Wuju Style.
DescriptionGame: Restores a small amount of health and mana over time. Grants temporary bonus to magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Drink: Restore 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana points. Advantage on saves vs. enchantment spells for 1 turn. Tea leaves can be used to detect poison in food/drink (6 in 6 chance).

Lore: A common sidearm in Bilgewater, often enchanted for extra punch. Used by bounty hunters and gang members alike.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and slows a target champion. Grants some lifesteal on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must make a DC 13 Fortitude save or be slowed for 1 round. User heals 1d4 hit points when dealing damage with the blade.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks and assassins, the Blink Dagger is rumored to be crafted with magic allowing for short-range teleportation.
DescriptionGame: Instantly blink a short distance. Cannot be used for a few seconds after taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Upon command, user vanishes and reappears up to 30' away. A strong blow disrupts the magic; user must SAVE vs. Spells or ability fails and renders them stunned for 1 round.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to contain blood magic, grants the wielder a shield based on damage dealt; possibly connected to Vladimir.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield based on damage dealt to enemy champions. Provides attack damage and lifesteal.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, gain temporary HP. This HP vanishes quickly. Save vs. Death when HP is reduced to 0, gain a lesser effect instead.

Lore: Favored by assassins. The necklace is rumored to contain the souls of those Rengar has hunted. Thus, it's influence waxes and wanes with each kill.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and movement speed upon takedowns. Upgrades with more kills.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to hit and damage rolls against creatures of the slain type. Further, wearer adds +1 to speed factor for each kill. However, should the wearer be slain, their soul is forfeit.

Lore: Simple footwear, common across Runeterra. But in Ionia, some believe even the road you walk shapes your destiny.
DescriptionGame: Slightly increased movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Wearer's base movement is increased by 20'. Decrease encounter distance by 1d4 x 10' due to increased travel speed. Save vs. surprise on even-numbered turns.

Lore: Likely crafted by a Hemomancer in Noxus, perhaps to sustain their power in combat, or to drain power from the enemies in order to grant it to its wielder.
DescriptionGame: Damaging champions heals you. Healing is increased based on missing health. Grants attack damage and ability haste.
DescriptionLore: On a successful hit, recover 1d4 hit points. If below half hit points, recover 1d6 instead. The wielder gains +2 on attack rolls and initiative.

Lore: Forged on Targon, it is said to protect against celestial wrath, favored by the Solari for its protective properties.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, armor, magic resist, and damage reduction for nearby allies upon taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to AC. When struck, allies within 10' gain +1 AC against the same attack type until the end of their next turn. Mountain's wrath lingers!

Lore: Favored by ambitious captains, this trinket whispers promises of swift voyages and plunder from distant shores.
DescriptionGame: Increases movement speed out of combat. Grants temporary movement speed boost when near turrets.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves swiftly when not threatened. Nearby friendly structures hasten the wearer's advance for one turn, but cannot move in the subsequent round.

Lore: Associated with the Crimson Circle, a secret society within Noxus known for their hemomancy and blood rituals.
DescriptionGame: Provides omnivamp and bonus attack damage that scales with missing health.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains HP on a hit; below 50% HP, deal +1d6 damage. On a critical hit, regain 1d4 lost HP. But at 0 HP, you must continue to feed the item!

Lore: Crafted by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it's rumored to be associated with the spirit realm and moments of perfect clarity.
DescriptionGame: Grants temporary immunity to crowd control effects and reduces incoming damage for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Negates all incoming hostile magic. The wielder is filled with unnatural speed as if blessed by the wind spirit. If wearing heavy armor, the next round's speed stat is treated as if unarmored.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energies, offering solace and balance to its wielder, reminiscent of the Aspect of Harmony.
DescriptionGame: Restores mana based on health spent, providing sustain in lane.
DescriptionLore: Grants advantage on saves vs. magical effects. Once per day, regain 1d6 lost hit points per level if your hit points are below half.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be quenched in the blood of conquered foes, it imbues its wearer with burning strength.
DescriptionGame: Immolate aura burns nearby enemies; bonus health and increased size. Damage scales with bonus health.
DescriptionLore: Creatures striking the wearer take 1d4 fire damage. +1 to saves vs. cold. The wearer counts as one size larger for grappling and intimidation.

Lore: Whispers say a master Ionian shadow dancer crafted these. Some link it to the conflicts surrounding the Kinkou Order.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and movement speed after dealing damage, enhancing burst potential and mobility.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to Surprise. On successful attack, move unseen to any location within line of sight, leaving no trace. If the attack misses, user is revealed.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins and those who delve into forbidden alchemy, it grants the drinker a temporary edge at a terrible price.
DescriptionGame: Consuming this potion grants health and mana over time and adds bonus damage to attacks and spells.
DescriptionLore: Upon drinking, roll a d6. On a 1, gain a point of corruption. At 6 corruption, character becomes an NPC under DM control. Grants +2 to attack rolls for 1d4 turns, regain 1d8 lost HP.

Lore: Whispers suggest the city's fall was due to a powerful Void incursion, leaving behind only echoes and this unsettling artifact.
DescriptionGame: Periodically unleash a wave of damage that slows enemies.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, emit a sonic blast. Save vs. Magic or be slowed for 1d4 turns. Undead are immune. Those slain by this item become husks.

Lore: Crafted with dark magic in the Shadow Isles, it is said to corrupt the wielder, drawing power from the souls of the dead.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage and grants bonus movement speed and stacking magic penetration upon hitting an enemy champion.
DescriptionLore: Suffer 1d4 Sanity when equipped. Each hit drains 1 HP from target, granting the wielder +1 temp HP and +1 to hit rolls against that foe for 1 turn.

Lore: Forged in the light of Targon, rumored to be connected to the Solari and their eternal conflict against the Lunari.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the wielder's next attack after using an ability, dealing bonus damage and granting movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Strike with celestial fury after channeling power. Successful hit grants +1 to next initiative roll as you surge with solar energy. However, the light fades, imposing -1 to hit chance next round.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists, its whirling blades are said to channel the spirits of past masters, enhancing agility and precision.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, attack speed, and movement speed. Unique active grants temporary bonus movement speed and phantomize.
DescriptionLore: On command, the wielder becomes as mist, gaining +2 to AC and +4 to saves vs. area attacks for 1 round. Afterwards, take 1d4 damage due to the strain of manipulating the life force.

Lore: This item seems to be associated with Ionian monks who are known for their movement techniques and spiritual attunement.
DescriptionGame: Allows more frequent use of Flash and Ghost summoner spells.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, teleport up to 30' or become invisible and move at double speed for 3 turns. Afterwards, make a DC 15 WIS save or be stunned for 1 turn.

Lore: Said to be crafted by a wandering monk, seeking enlightenment, for disciples of his order. Perhaps connected to a forgotten spirit.
DescriptionGame: Grants mana regeneration and healing power, useful for sustain in lane.
DescriptionLore: The bearer regenerates 5 MP per turn, and healing spells or potions are +1 HP/level more effective. Prolonged use risks attracting spirits, requiring a WIS save to avoid possession.

Lore: Crafted from lost Freljordian ice magic, the shield whispers forgotten tales of the fallen Iceborn.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, health regeneration, and ability power.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 hit points, heals 1d4 hit points per turn, and spells are cast as if the wielder was one level higher. But beware the whispers of the shield— heed them not!

Lore: Forged by celestial artisans on Mount Targon, rumored to shatter nightmares and grant clarity in the face of oblivion.
DescriptionGame: Deals AoE damage on active, grants a shield, and empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage.
DescriptionLore: Active: Shatters illusions and dispels fear. 1d6 Bludgeoning damage to ethereal foes. Shield grants +2 to saves vs. mind-altering effects. Next attack deals +1d4 damage and briefly stuns (DC 13 WIL save negates).

Lore: Named after Eleisa, a Demacian healer known for her compassion. Possibly associated with the Lightbringers, a monastic order devoted to healing.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, mana regeneration, and reduces crowd control duration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. charm and paralysis. Once per day, can replenish 1d6 hit points or recover from being stunned if incapacitated.

Lore: Potent brew favored by Demacian artificers enhancing innovation, now outlawed due to volatile side effects.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus Ability Power, Attack Damage, and Cooldown Reduction for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: For 10 minutes, cast spells as if two levels higher and deal +2 damage; after, roll a d6. On a 1, experience is cursed: next level requires double XP.

Lore: Potent brew favored by Noxian siege engineers and demolitionists, known for its volatile enhancement of destructive capabilities.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health, increased damage to turrets, and bonus attack damage to minions.
DescriptionLore: Drink grants +2 to hit structures, +1 damage. Allies within 30' suffer -1 to hit, unless immune to fear. Duration: 3 turns. Potential side effect: uncontrollable fits of giggling.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, the Emblem of Valor is often used by soldiers needing to prove their loyalty and bravery to their leaders.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health regeneration based on missing health, increasing survivability in prolonged fights.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals 1d4 hit points per turn while below half hit points. Grants +1 to morale checks when facing overwhelming odds. If the wearer retreats, the emblem crumbles to dust.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this item might have been used by a brutal warlord to suppress rebellions or enforce conscription.
DescriptionGame: Taunt nearby enemies upon immobilizing an enemy champion.
DescriptionLore: Upon hindering a foe, all lesser beings nearby must test Morale (failure means fleeing or cowering for 1d4 turns). Those immune to fear gain -2 to hit the wielder.

Lore: The Entropy Field hums with the chaotic energy of the Crimson Circle, possibly used in their brutal arena rituals. It shifts the very fabric of reality around it.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and slows enemies upon impact, creating a zone that slows enemies inside it.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, inflicts 1d6 entropy damage, slowing movement by half for 1 round. Area effect: 10' radius, saves vs magic or be slowed. Continued exposure causes mutation - roll on corruption table.

Lore: Favored by Demacian sentries on long patrols, Espresso Snax are rumored to be baked with enchanted coffee beans from distant lands.
DescriptionGame: Grants a temporary burst of movement speed and increased attack speed.
DescriptionLore: Upon consumption: +2 to SPD for 1d4 turns and +1 to hit for 1d4 rounds. Potential side effect: Uncontrolled chattering (5% chance).

Lore: Favored by lower-ranking officers in Noxus, the Evenshroud is thought to provide protection and is associated with the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Reduces affected enemies' resistances, increasing damage dealt to them.
DescriptionLore: Enemies within 60' suffer -2 to all saves vs. spells. Attacks against them gain +1 to hit and +1 to damage for 6 turns. Save vs. Spells or be stunned for 1 turn.

Lore: The storm seems to call out to the stars, perhaps created by an aspect of the celestial realm.
DescriptionGame: Brings the target to you, and slows for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Creature is pulled 30' in a straight line toward the user. Save vs. Paralysis or be slowed for 1d4 rounds (half movement, -2 to hit).

Lore: Favored by Demacian scouts, allowing them to safely navigate uncharted regions and provide early warnings against potential threats.
DescriptionGame: Places a visible ward that reveals the surrounding area for a duration.
DescriptionLore: When planted, the ward creates a shimmering beacon. Creatures within 30' are easily spotted. Undead might take 1d6 damage if they fail a save vs. magic.

Lore: An ancient relic from the Frozen Watchers, radiating intense cold and magical power, with possible connections to Lissandra.
