DescriptionGame: Periodically slows nearby enemies. Grants ability haste and mana regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Creatures near the wielder must SAVE vs. cold or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Grants +2 to cast spells, restores 1 spell slot per day.

Lore: Linked to the ancient Aspects of Targon, granting sight and protection. Possibly connected to champions like Taric or Leona.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, mana regeneration, and vision through placed wards.
DescriptionLore: Allows the user to cast See Invisible 3/day. Grants +1 AC. When depleted, shatters, releasing a burst of harmless light, possibly alerting nearby monsters.

Lore: Likely originating from Shurima's oasis, it might be tied to ancient guardians or benevolent spirits of the desert.
DescriptionGame: Periodically heals nearby allies and restores mana to the wielder.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, touch the eye to replenish 1d6 lost HP or MP to a character within 30'. On a failed save vs. WIS, the user has vivid dreams of the Oasis.

Lore: Linked to the Watchers of the Freljord, ancient beings of ice and void.
DescriptionGame: Provides ability power, mana regeneration, and executes low-health minions.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to cast spells, replenishes mana. Usable once per day: Instantly slay a creature with HD less than your level. Failure results in character aging 1d4 years.

Lore: Likely crafted by a Solari order, used by scouts and sentinels to watch for signs of the Void's corruption on Runeterra.
DescriptionGame: Reveals a small area at long range for a short duration. Limited range early, improving with level.
DescriptionLore: Cast Light beyond normal limits. Reveals secrets to those who dare look far. But beware, for what you see, may see you also. Range increases with caster level; 20' per level.

Lore: Worn by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the Flash Zone aids in swift escapes or ambushes, resonating with the land's inherent magic.
DescriptionGame: Short-range teleport with a brief invulnerability window after arrival.
DescriptionLore: Usable once per day. Instantly teleport up to 30' away. Roll a d6: on a 1-2, target location is hazardous; on a 5-6, brief shimmer provides +2 AC for 1 round.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, this armament might have belonged to a Dauntless Vanguard, or a member of the Crownguard.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and health, scaling with champion level.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage. When HP is reduced to 0, roll a d6. On a 6, the wearer remains at 1 HP, otherwise death. Effect can trigger once per dawn.

Lore: Likely forged by the Iceborn, or by the followers of Volibear, this crest provides the wearer a burning aura.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies every second.
DescriptionLore: Creatures near the bearer take 1d4 fire damage each round; save versus breath weapon for half. Grants +1 to saves versus cold.

Lore: May be linked to the Winter's Claw, perhaps used as a food source during harsh winters. Could also be associated with yetis.
DescriptionGame: Restores a small amount of health and mana. Grants a temporary movement speed boost upon consumption.
DescriptionLore: Heals 1d4 hp and 1d4 mp. Additionally, the imbiber moves as if under the 'haste' spell for 3 turns, though their AC is reduced by 1 due to the sudden burst of energy.

Lore: Likely forged by the Ice Witch Lissandra's servants. Grants resistance to flame and creates a zone of perpetual frost.
DescriptionGame: Empowers basic attacks to create a slowing field, also grants increased armor and magic resist.
DescriptionLore: Melee attacks encase foes in ice (Save vs. Paralysis). Grants +2 to AC vs. fire-based attacks. Creatures entering your zone of influence must Save vs. Cold or suffer -1 to hit.

Lore: The Frozen Mallet could be associated with the Freljord, as it embodies the chilling power of the north and slowing enemies with ice.
DescriptionGame: It grants health and attack damage and slows enemies on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must make a save vs. paralysis or be slowed. Movement reduced to 1/2 for 1d4 turns. Grants +1 to saves vs. cold.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers, particularly those facing monstrous threats or heavily armored Noxian legions, embodying the spirit of overcoming overwhelming odds.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to champions with greater maximum health.
DescriptionLore: Confers Advantage on attack rolls against giants, dragons, and enemies of noble birth. Grants +1 to damage per Hit Die difference, up to a maximum of +6.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the Aspect of Twilight, granting clarity and foresight to its user, especially among the Rakkor.
DescriptionGame: Grants the user increased mana regeneration and ability haste.
DescriptionLore: When held, the wielder must Save vs. Spells or be compelled to speak the truth. Grants +1 to hit rolls when fighting in dim light or darkness.

Lore: Favored by Noxian battlemages and warlords, it's believed to be tied to hemomancy and brutal, decisive victories, possibly Vladimir or the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and heals the user. Grants bonus attack damage. Grants health and attack damage based on enemies nearby.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to hit and damage. Once per day, if at 0 hp, regain 1d8 hp. On a natural 1, the sword demands a blood sacrifice; lose 1 permanent CON.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies, rumored to grant wearers brief control over gravity, potentially linked to the Aspect of Twilight.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased movement speed and the ability to briefly ignore unit collision.
DescriptionLore: Wearer can ignore difficult terrain and gains +1 to hit rolls when jumping down on an enemy. Once per day, may cast 'feather fall' on self.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, potentially linked to the Aspects.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased magic resist and ability power when fully charged.
DescriptionLore: Upon attunement, the orb grants +2 to saves vs. magic. On a failed save, user must make a DC 15 Will save or be overcome by visions of the celestial realm.

Lore: Favored by Shuriman desert travelers, the Greater Totem provides crucial knowledge of approaching dangers, both seen and unseen in the sands.
DescriptionGame: Periodically grants a free ward. Upgrades Stealth Ward to Greater Stealth Totem for longer duration and increased vision range.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, user can see invisible entities or traps within 60ft. Usable three times before needing a full day's recharge. User may ignore the need for recharge at the cost of attracting hostile unseen entities.

Lore: Associated with restless spirits and the spectral realm. Perhaps a tool for navigating or manipulating the undead energies of the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionGame: Reveals invisible units and grants bonus damage against monsters.
DescriptionLore: Detect ethereal beings and strike with +1 to hit undead, dealing +1d4 damage. Lantern sheds dim light, spooking animals and attracting spectres.

Lore: Favored by Noxian warmasons and Freljordian raiders, the Hamstringer hobbles foes, leaving them vulnerable. Useful for warriors seeking an advantage in the icy north.
DescriptionGame: Dealing damage slows the target, making it easier to chase or escape.
DescriptionLore: Target must SAVE vs DEX or suffer -2 to movement speed. Additionally, they attack at disadvantage vs. user for the next round, or until they receive healing.

Lore: A trophy taken from Kha'Zix. Symbolizes dominance over the Void and its creatures. Could be related to Rek'Sai or other Voidborn.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage. Killing Kha'Zix grants additional, permanent attack damage.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to hit rolls, +1 to damage rolls. If used to slay a Void creature, gain a permanent +1 to Strength (max +3), but also 1d4 Corruption.

Lore: Forged on Targon, it shares health and gold. A bond of support, perhaps linked to the Solari's ideals of protection.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and executes low health minions to grant gold to an ally.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals slightly faster. Execute a nearly dead creature, transferring its lifeforce (gold) to an ally. Range: touch.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be imbued with the essence of a vanquished fire mage. A favored weapon of warlords.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus magic damage on hit and grants stacking magic penetration, decaying over time.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, victim suffers +1 damage/level spell-like fire damage and subtracts 1 from magic resistance per hit, up to target's level. Resistance returns at 1/hour.

Lore: Crude hextech components hint at early Piltover and Zaunite influence in Ionia, or perhaps an Ionian attempt to replicate it.
DescriptionGame: Provides ability power, health, and mana. Can be upgraded into more powerful versions.
DescriptionLore: User gains +1 to cast damage, +3 hit points, and the ability to cast 1 extra spell before requiring rest. When upgraded, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the core implodes, dealing 2d6 damage.

Lore: Prototype technology, likely developed in Zaun or by a Noxian artificer, for rapid battlefield traversal and engagement. May have ties to Viktor's Glorious Evolution.
DescriptionGame: Dashes a short distance and unleashes a nova of magic missiles.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, propel yourself 30' forward. All within 10' take 1d6 magic damage (save versus magic to halve). Roll a d6: on a 1, the belt malfunctions and you are stunned for 1 round.

Lore: Whispers link it to fallen Targonian aspects, perhaps those who dared defy the stars' rigid paths.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed and magic resist after casting your ultimate ability.
DescriptionLore: Upon utterance of a final, powerful word, wearer gains +2 to speed and resists magic for 1d4 rounds. Chance of attracting unwanted celestial attention (GM discretion).

Lore: Favored by Ionian hunters and spirit walkers, allows one to track down dangerous beasts of the forests.
DescriptionGame: Bonus damage to monsters and increased experience gained from killing monsters in the jungle.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to tracking, +1 damage die on attacks against beasts. Spend 1 turn after battle butchering the beast. Replenishes 1d4 food.

Lore: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers and shadow stalkers, channels vital essence for hunting.
DescriptionGame: Bonus mana regen in the jungle and bonus damage to monsters.
DescriptionLore: Upon consumption of slain monsters, regain 1d4 mana. Furthermore, successfully tracking a beast yields advantage on your next attack roll.

Lore: Said to be created with concentrated starlight, this substance is rumored to enhance one's connection to the celestial realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus ability power and mana regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Drinking this ichor allows the imbiber to cast one additional spell, but they take 1d6 radiant damage. A second draught is poison!

Lore: Crafted by Demacian artisans, rumored to have protective enchantments from a Radiantite shard, safeguarding the wielder.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield when taking damage that would reduce you below a certain health threshold.
DescriptionLore: Wearer is enveloped in shimmering light when near death; prevents the next lethal blow. Foe must save vs. magic or be blinded for 1d4 rounds by the radiance.

Lore: Celestial in origin, resonating with the power of constellations and cosmic balance. Grants power from beyond the stars.
DescriptionGame: Periodically empowers abilities, increasing damage based on time spent in combat and champion level.
DescriptionLore: Once per round, reroll any die, adding your level to the result. On a natural 1 or 20, the stars align, granting advantage on all rolls for [level] rounds.

Lore: Favored by the Solari, the locket may possess lunar magic, a counter to the Lunari. Perhaps tied to Leona's power and devotion to the sun.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and health regeneration. Activates to shield nearby allies from incoming damage.
DescriptionLore: A shimmering field envelops allies: 2d6 damage negated. Undead hesitate to attack those shielded, unless compelled.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena masters and pit fighters, this brutal whip embodies strength through dominance. Used to control beasts and break the wills of foes.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage to nearby enemies and grants movement speed when used. Useful for clearing waves and chasing enemies.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save versus STR or be knocked prone. Those immune to being knocked prone must save versus WIL or be stunned for 1 round. User gains +1 to movement for 1 round.

Lore: Possibly named after a forgotten Freljordian hero. The item is a key component in more powerful equipment.
DescriptionGame: Grants health and attack damage that increases upon killing enemy units.
DescriptionLore: Wielder gains 1hp and +1 to hit for each foe slain in combat, lasting until the next dawn. If the fist is broken, the rage is dispelled.

Lore: Forged by the Solari, it resonates with celestial energy, offering protection against magical assaults for those deemed worthy by the Mountain.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and a shield that absorbs magic damage. The shield regenerates when out of combat.
DescriptionLore: Confers Advantage on saves vs. spells and spell-like abilities. If a saving throw is failed against a magical attack, the Rookern absorbs a portion of the blow; for 1d4 rounds, incoming magic damage is reduced by 2 points.

Lore: Forged on Targon's slopes, it resonates with celestial energy, granting vitality and resilience to its wielder.
DescriptionGame: Grants health and ability haste, reducing cooldowns and increasing survivability in combat.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to hit dice rolls when resisting spells and poison, and heals 1d4 hp a turn when below half health.

Lore: Forged by a Demacian artificer, the Kircheis Shard is rumored to amplify the wielder's intent, channeling inner energy into a potent strike.
DescriptionGame: Energized attacks deal bonus magic damage and grant bonus movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Next melee attack deals +1d6 lightning damage and grants +1 to movement until end of turn. Chance to attract unwanted elemental attention from the sky.

Lore: Knights Vow is linked to Demacia and their ideals of protection and sacrifice. It is likely tied to a specific order of knights.
DescriptionGame: Redirects damage from an ally to the wearer, healing based on damage dealt by the ally.
DescriptionLore: The wearer designates a target, who becomes harder to hit (-2 AC). 10% of damage to the wearer is negated, but the target suffers equivalent damage as psychic feedback. Further, the wearer heals 1d6 hp when the target strikes a foe.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have been used in assassinations, allows the user to pierce through the toughest armor.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor penetration, allowing physical damage to bypass a portion of the target's armor.
DescriptionLore: Bypass DR X times per day. On critical hit, bypass all DR. Weapon degrades non-magical armor it strikes. Undead and constructs are immune.

Lore: Favored by assassins in the empire. Legends says they grant the wielder enhanced stealth and lethality.
DescriptionGame: Grants lethality and movement speed, increasing damage to isolated targets.
DescriptionLore: Upon a successful hit, target must save versus death or drop to 0 hp. On a miss, the attacker is revealed and takes double damage from all sources for 1 round.

Lore: Crafted by Ionian monks, this staff enhances natural magic, resonating with the spirit realm and amplifying a mage's connection to the land.
DescriptionGame: The item grants increased magic power, mana regeneration, and reduces ability cooldowns.
DescriptionLore: Upon attunement, gain +2 to spellcasting rolls. Spend a turn in meditation to recover a lost spell slot (level 3 or lower). Once per day, commune with local spirits for cryptic advice.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, imbued with celestial power. Favored by support Ascended and the Solari for aiding allies in need.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and vision. Provides bonus health, mana regen, and ability haste, enhancing support capabilities.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, touch a willing ally to grant +1 to all saving throws for 1d4 turns. User gains temporary blindness for one turn after use.

Lore: Rumored to have been crafted from a sea monster's hide, Leviathan whispers promises of power and dominance to its wielder.
DescriptionGame: Grants health and damage based on takedowns, lost on death. Resets stacks upon reaching maximum.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to AC. Each successful hit grants +1 temporary HP (max 10). Upon death, character returns at 1 HP. If character achieves 10 successful hits, character cannot die until the next dawn.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and its lingering magic, tormenting those who dare wield it. May be related to the Ruination.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus magic damage over time and increased damage to slowed or immobilized targets.
DescriptionLore: Those struck suffer 1d4 damage each round for 3 rounds (save allowed). Those bound or slowed suffer 1d6 damage instead. Wielder must save vs. death each week or become a wraith.

Lore: Favored by warriors facing impossible odds in the Freljord, a 'Lifeline' is a blessing of the Ice Witch, granting temporary reprieve.
DescriptionGame: Shields the user from lethal damage and grants bonus attack damage when triggered.
DescriptionLore: Wearer is immune to a single source of damage. Upon trigger, gain +2 to hit and damage rolls for the next round, representing desperate aggression.

Lore: Potentially forged by a Demacian artisan, rumored to channel the power of starlight. Might have been wielded by a hero fighting the darkness.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to enemies. Grants the wielder increased movement speed and attack speed for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Suffer +1 AC from magical darkness. When swung, brightly illuminate a 30' radius. On hit, all undead and demons flee from the light (save vs. spell or turn to ash).

Lore: Forged on Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Often carried by those who stand against overwhelming darkness, inspired by the sun.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resist and health. Active: grants a shield to nearby allies, protecting them from damage.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, emit a radiant burst: allies within 30' gain 3d6 temporary hit points, absorb the next magic attack targeting them.

Lore: Recovered from a drowned Oracle, it whispers secrets of unseen dangers, possibly linked to ancient sea curses or forgotten leviathans.
DescriptionGame: Detects invisible enemy units and disables enemy traps for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Grants 1 turn of 'True Sight' (60ft range) and automatically disarms one magical trap. On a failed save (WIS 13), user experiences disturbing visions.

Lore: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used to focus magical studies. May have been owned by a powerful spirit walker.
DescriptionGame: Grants mana, ability haste, and mana regeneration upon leveling up.
DescriptionLore: The chapter grants +1 to cast spells, replenishing mana (spell slots) upon leveling up. However, overuse might attract spirits to the caster.

Lore: The echo resonates with ancient Ionian magic, amplifying the wearer's spells, connecting them to the spirit realm and first lands.
DescriptionGame: Damaging abilities grant stacks. At 100 stacks, the next damaging ability consumes all stacks to deal bonus magic damage to the target and nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, unleash stored magical energy as a wave dealing 2d6 damage to all within 30'. Save vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round. User must meditate for 1 turn to recharge.

Lore: Potentially associated with the ancient magic of Ionia and its reverence for spiritual energy. Could be tied to the Vastaya.
DescriptionGame: Damaging abilities grant stacks. At 100 stacks, the next damaging ability consumes all stacks to deal bonus damage and bounces to nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting a spell, roll a d6. On a 6, the spell chains to another target within sight, dealing half damage. The caster glows faintly for one turn.

Lore: Gamblers in Bilgewater often carry trinkets like these dice, hoping to sway Lady Luck in their favor during high-stakes games.
DescriptionGame: On a dice roll, reroll twice and take the highest result.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, reroll any failed roll. On a natural 1, the dice crumble to dust.

Lore: Favored by monstrous creature hunters in the pits of Noxus, this item was made to quickly dispatch large beasts.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to monsters and grants a chance to deal bonus damage on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a successful hit against a monstrous creature, roll 1d6. On a 6, deal double damage. If damage exceeds HP, the creature explodes in a shower of gore.

Lore: Whispers from the celestial realm suggest a connection to fallen watchers and their influence on Runeterra's magic, amplified through Targon's celestial energies.
DescriptionGame: Imbues magic damage with burning, reducing magic resist of enemies hit and creating a damaging area.
DescriptionLore: Casting spells risks attracting otherworldly attention, inflicting a burning curse (-1 to saves vs. magic) and creating a zone of aberrant energy (1d6 damage/round, save vs. magic to negate).

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace and harmony, aiding meditation and channeling of spiritual energy.
DescriptionGame: Provides increased mana regeneration. Grants bonus mana upon using an ability.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells without components. Recover 1d4 mana per turn meditating. On a roll of 1, the meditation draws unwanted attention.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, Manamune's creation involved spirit magic, resonating with the land's inherent energy and the interconnectedness of its inhabitants.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage based on maximum mana and refunds mana on ability casts, stacking to transform into Muramana.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage rolls for every 5 points of mana. Spells cost 1 less mana. When mana is exhausted, the blade transforms, dealing +1d6 damage on a hit until rested.

Lore: Crafted from shipwrecked souls and sea salt, it whispers tales of vengeance from the depths. Associated with lost mariners.
DescriptionGame: Upon taking fatal damage, become untargetable and continue attacking for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Upon death, the wielder's spirit lingers, fueled by rage. They lash out with spectral attacks before passing on, possibly becoming a ghost if slain again during this period (1-in-6 chance).

Lore: Potentially linked to Demacian knights, as a tool to protect allies and inspire courage through self-sacrifice.
DescriptionGame: Taunts nearby enemies, reduces damage taken, and deals damage to nearby enemies upon damage taken and at the end of the duration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to AC, but all attacks targetting allies within 30' are redirected to them, attacker makes a DC 15 WIL save or attacks the wearer. On expiring, explodes for 2d6 damage to all within 10'.

Lore: Associated with dark magic and power accumulation, perhaps favored by ambitious Noxian mages seeking forbidden knowledge. Could be connected to the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power upon champion kills and assists, lost on death. Stacks up to 25 times for massive AP.
DescriptionLore: Steal the souls of slain foes. Each soul grants +1 to cast checks. On death, roll a d6; on a 1-3, lose half of your stacks. On a 4-6, lose all stacks.

Lore: Linked to an ancient order on Targon, dedicated to purity and protection against corruption from the Void.
DescriptionGame: Removes all crowd control effects from an ally and grants them a brief period of crowd control immunity.
DescriptionLore: Touch ally to negate paralysis, poison, and charm. Target gains +4 to saves vs. mental effects for 3 turns. Upon use, user ages 1d4 weeks, reflecting the blessing's burden.

Lore: Potentially a tool utilized by the Ascended to manage and control the flow of lesser beings and resources within their empire.
DescriptionGame: Consumes minions to gain damage bonuses against that minion type.
DescriptionLore: As an action, touch a corporeal undead to attempt to banish it. The target must make a saving throw vs. item level or be instantly turned to harmless dust.

Lore: Favored by messengers and scouts across the desert, granting swift passage between oases and ancient ruins. Often enchanted with protective spirits.
DescriptionGame: Greatly increased out-of-combat movement speed, reduced when in combat.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves at x2 speed when unburdened. If attacked, must SAVE vs. DEX 14 or boots slow to normal speed for 1d4 turns. Blessed versions may ignore the SAVE.

Lore: Linked to the Lunari, wielding moon magic. Might be associated with champions like Diana, who draws power from the moon.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and ability haste, while also providing a shield after casting an ultimate ability.
DescriptionLore: Grants advantage on saving throws vs. magic and grants the wearer a ward that absorbs damage once per day after calling upon their inner power (casting a 6th level spell or higher).

Lore: Associated with forbidden knowledge and necromantic practices within Noxus. Possibly tied to the Black Rose or dark mages seeking immortality.
DescriptionGame: Applies Grievous Wounds to enemies hit by abilities, reducing their healing.
DescriptionLore: Target's wounds fester, healing provides no succor. Saving throw (Wisdom) or incur disadvantage on subsequent Constitution checks until healed by divine magic or a full day's rest.

Lore: Rumored to be crafted for the Ascended, perhaps at the behest of a long-lost emperor for a monstrous champion.
DescriptionGame: Grants AP, attack speed, and on-hit damage; perfect for hybrid damage dealers who weave spells and attacks.
DescriptionLore: Wielder gains +2 to hit in melee, +2 to cast spells. On a hit, target must SAVE vs. Poison or take 1d6 damage. Breaks if used by a non-mage.

Lore: Favored by mages in Ionia, enhancing their natural connection to the spirit realm and amplifying their spellcasting abilities.
DescriptionGame: Grants a large amount of ability power, increasing the damage of spells.
DescriptionLore: Rod imbues +1d4 to magic damage rolls. However, if 1 is rolled, the spell fizzles, and the caster takes 1d4 backlash damage.

Lore: Whispers suggest it's linked to a fallen Shadow Isles mage, seeking to corrupt the living with arcane power.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability haste and mana. Empowers the user's next ability after casting an ultimate.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, after casting a ritual of 6th level or higher, the next spell cast before the sun rises is cast as if by a scroll, ignoring material components up to 50 gold.

Lore: Favored by Ionian martial artists. Legends say masters can move like shadows while wearing them, blending into the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Reduces damage from basic attacks and provides movement speed.
DescriptionLore: AC 13. wearer reduces damage from mundane missile attacks by 2 points and moves +10' when exploring or evading in wilderness or urban environments. If fleeing reduce encounter distance by half.

Lore: Associated with Targon's nomadic people. Grants resilience and empowers allies nearby, embodying the mountain's supportive aspect.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration, mana regeneration, and bonus gold. Provides aura of mana regen to nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals 1hp per round and regenerates 1 mana per turn. Allies within 30' also regen mana. +1 to saves vs. exhaustion.

Lore: Crafted by Demacian mages, the Null-Magic Mantle protects against arcane threats, commonly used by frontline soldiers and mageseekers.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resistance, reducing damage taken from enemy abilities.
DescriptionLore: Confers advantage on saves versus spells and magical effects. On a failed save, halve damage. If already resistant to magic, reduce magical damage taken by one-quarter.

Lore: Favored by Noxian commanders, the Obsidian Cleaver sunders armor, leaving enemies vulnerable to further assaults. Represents raw, brutal power.
DescriptionGame: Deals physical damage, reduces enemy armor, and grants movement speed on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save vs. crushing blow or suffer -1 to AC. Cleaving a foe strengthens the wielder, increasing movement by 10' for a turn.

Lore: Likely crafted by the ancient Iceborn, a relic against magical assaults. Perhaps tied to a forgotten god or powerful ice witch.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and reduces incoming magic damage. Provides a burst of damage upon taking enough magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. spells. If targeted by a harmful spell, unleash a shock dealing 1d6 cold damage to the caster.

Lore: Favored by those scaling the mountain, rumored to be blessed by ancient aspects for protection.
DescriptionGame: Disables nearby enemy turrets for a short duration, allowing for safer sieges.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, emit a pulse. Stone and metal constructs nearby become inert for 1d4 rounds. A save versus magic negates.

Lore: Crafted by a reclusive Ionian bladesmith, rumored to have ties to the ancient teachings of the Kinkou Order.
DescriptionGame: Dashes empower your next attack to slow the target and deal bonus damage.
DescriptionLore: On a hit after dashing, target must SAVE vs DEX or be slowed (treat as entangled), and take +1d6 damage. User is momentarily winded (-1 to next roll).

Lore: Potentially used by Demacian mageseekers to detect hidden magic or illusions. Could be associated with Sylas's escape.
DescriptionGame: Grants true sight, revealing invisible units and disabling enemy wards for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Reveals invisible creatures and traps. Grants advantage on saving throws vs. illusions. Causes a burning sensation when near magical items and spellcasters.

Lore: Forged on Targon, rumored to ward against celestial trickery or the gaze of Aspects. Sought after by those who deal with cosmic entities.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resistance. Passively grants immunity to magic damage every 90 seconds.
DescriptionLore: Wearer is +3 to saves vs. illusion and mind-affecting magic. Once per day, wearer ignores the effects of a single harmful spell that targets them.

Lore: Likely forged in the Freljord, possibly tied to the Winter's Claw or another ice-based faction. Grants resilience in harsh conditions.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health, mana, and ability haste. Transforms into Fimbulwinter when meeting certain conditions.
DescriptionLore: Grants +3 to saves vs. cold, provides 1 ration of food per day, and once per day, creates a barrier of ice that absorbs 1d6 damage. If broken, the Orb shatters, becoming useless.

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena champions, Overlord's Bloodmail is a testament to brutal strength and the will to dominate, embodying the empire's values.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, attack damage, and temporary bonus health/size on takedown.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 hit points. On slaying a foe, swell to ogre-size for 1d4 turns (+1 to hit, -1 AC). Afterwards, must SAVE vs. Poison or be Exhausted.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, these pauldrons are rumored to have been worn by a forgotten Iceborn warrior.
DescriptionGame: Immobilizing an enemy grants bonus armor and magic resist to nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: When wearer freezes a foe, allies gain +2 AC and +1 to saves vs. magic for 3 turns. The pauldrons whisper forgotten battle tactics.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the Zephyr winds of Ionia, granting the wearer unnatural agility and speed. Perhaps a connection to a wind spirit.
DescriptionGame: +25 Attack Damage, +25% Attack Speed, +10% Cooldown Reduction, +10% Movement Speed.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to DEX. Once per day, reroll a failed DEX saving throw. Subject to whims of weather, storms may hinder its power (-1 DEX in strong winds).

Lore: Forged in Demacia, rumored to be blessed by Kayle. Grants brief invulnerability, favored by mages escaping Noxian ambushes.
DescriptionGame: Grants temporary invulnerability, rendering the champion unable to move or act during the stasis.
DescriptionLore: Allows the user to briefly step outside of time, becoming untouchable but unable to act. Roll a d6; on a 1, you are shunted to a random point in time.

Lore: Favored by lowborn arena fighters in Noxus, the Phage's brutal design reflects the region's harsh gladiatorial traditions and thirst for blood.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health and attack damage. Attacks grant a temporary movement speed bonus.
DescriptionLore: Upon a hit, chance to inflict 'momentum'. Momentum grants +1 to movement and attack rolls for 1 round. If already affected by momentum, target must save vs. STR or be knocked prone.

Lore: Favored by ascetics and wandering mystics in Targon seeking enlightenment. Often found near sites of great contemplation.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration and mana regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Wearer recovers 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana each turn. While meditating, recovery is doubled. May attract celestial beings or maddening whispers from beyond.

Lore: Whispers link it to a forgotten Ionian wind spirit, granting swiftness to those deemed worthy. Some believe it responds to inner peace.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus move speed and magic resistance after casting your ultimate, decaying over time.
DescriptionLore: Upon unleashing a potent spell, move with unnatural speed (+2 to initiative, +10' movement) and resist magic. Save vs. magic or speed wanes after 3 rounds.

Lore: Likely plundered from a rival pirate crew or a foolish merchant vessel, hinting at the unscrupulous nature of Bilgewater's inhabitants.
DescriptionGame: Restores health over time.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing this murky brew grants +4 hit points over 1d4 turns. Side effects may include scurvy, sea shanties and uncontrollable greed.

Lore: Likely stolen from a rival pirate crew or found in a hidden cove, used to scout out enemies.
DescriptionGame: Places a temporary, invisible ward, revealing the surrounding area for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Creates a magical sensor, revealing invisible creatures or pathways, lasts 6 turns. Range: 60'. Detects illusions, shadows, or magical traps.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, the dirk is often used to secure bounties. The dirk is rumored to be crafted from metal sourced from a fallen darkin.
DescriptionGame: Killing large monsters grants bonus gold and empowers your next attack.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a beast, gain +1 to your next attack roll. If the beast has 3+ HD, also gain 1d6 gold. Gold disappears at the end of the day.

Lore: Poro-Snax are beloved by poros, creatures native to the Freljord, often found around hearths and ancient ruins. Feeding them strengthens their bond.
DescriptionGame: Summoner's Rift: Feeds a poro, making it grow. Howling Abyss: Throws a Poro-Snax, which poros will run towards.
DescriptionLore: Creatures fed Poro-Snax become docile. A single snax thrown can distract beasts up to Huge size. A hoard of such creatures could be used as distractions or living walls.

Lore: Whispers say the Pox Arcana was penned by a hemomancer seeking to weaponize disease for the empire.
DescriptionGame: Dealing ability damage applies a stacking poison that deals magic damage over time.
DescriptionLore: Target suffers -1 to saves vs. poison/disease per stack. At 3 stacks, target must save vs. death or be stricken with a wasting illness, taking 1d4 damage per day until cured.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Might have connection with the Solari or Lunari.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage based on max health, heals based on damage dealt, and grants bonus armor/MR based on health.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 AC per 10 HP. Strikes deal +1 damage per character level. User heals 1d4 HP per successful hit. Undead flee if damage exceeds their current HP.

Lore: Whispers say Priscilla, a forgotten noble, blessed it for her champions. Now it is a symbol of cruel ambition, sought by those craving power.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack speed and movement speed after scoring a takedown.
DescriptionLore: Upon a kill, wearer gains +1 to attack rolls and +2" movement for 1d4 rounds. On a critical failure wearer is stunned for 1 round.

Lore: The blade is rumored to have been forged in the Freljord, possibly by a forgotten tribe seeking to claim new lands and resources.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and a passive gold generation effect while last hitting minions.
DescriptionLore: The blade whispers secrets of nearby wealth (veins of ore, monster lairs). On a successful parry, the wielder can detect hidden passages within 30 ft for 1 round.

Lore: Associated with Viktor, and the founding of the Glorious Evolution. Could be tied to the Spirit of Innovation, if Ionia ever focused on tech.
DescriptionGame: Provides stats and can be upgraded to enhance Viktor's abilities.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to a stat chosen at dawn. Each upgrade permanently enhances a specific skill; roll 1d6 to determine which. On a 6, instead, a random other player suffers -1 to a stat of your choice.

Lore: Whispers claim these threads are spun from the souls of the damned, granting control over the living.
DescriptionGame: Charm an enemy champion, forcing them to attack their allies for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: On a failed save, puppeted creature attacks nearest ally (50% chance of target). Save allowed each round. Puppeteer takes 1d4 damage for each round of control.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking clarity and protection from outside influences. It is sometimes seen amongst travelling merchants in Bilgewater.
DescriptionGame: Removes all crowd control effects. Grants brief immunity to further crowd control.
DescriptionLore: Grants a save versus enchantment/charm effects. If successful, you are also freed from any current bindings, petrification, or paralysis. Lasts 1 round.

Lore: Favored by mages in Ionia, Rabadon's Deathcrown is a symbol of magical prowess and deep understanding of arcane energies, possibly connected to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Massively increases Ability Power, amplifying the potency of magical abilities.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +5 to Magic Saves. Spells cast inflict +1 damage die. But take -1 on saves vs. illusions as the crown clouds mind with visions.

Lore: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers, it aids traversing untamed lands, ensuring harmony with nature's path.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus experience from large monsters and increased mana regeneration in the jungle.
DescriptionLore: Allows safe passage through the wilderness. When used, roll 1d6, on a 1-2 attract a monster, 3-4 find herbs, 5-6 move twice as far.

Lore: Favored by scouts patrolling Demacia's borders, allowing for faster movement between outposts.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed near turrets and increased health regeneration when damaged by enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves swiftly near fortifications. Incoming attacks mend flesh (+2hp/round) so long as attacker is visible.

Lore: Rectrix, a quill from a celestial being, perhaps related to the Aspect of Justice or Judgment.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the next three spells cast, granting bonus damage and reducing mana cost.
DescriptionLore: Next 3 spells cast are at +1 to cast and are automatically known. If spell is unknown, there is a 1-in-6 chance to forget it after casting.

Lore: Associated with the celestial, embodying sacrifice and healing, perhaps linked to the Aspect of the Host.
DescriptionGame: Heals allies in an area after a delay. Can be used while dead.
DescriptionLore: Activate to call upon divine intervention. 3d6 HP restored to those within a 30' radius after 2 rounds. Usable from beyond the veil, but taxes the soul: User takes 1d4 damage.

Lore: Commonly used by travelers and adventurers, rumored to be brewed with rare Ionian herbs known for their restorative properties.
DescriptionGame: Slowly restores health over a short duration, providing sustain in lane or during skirmishes.
DescriptionLore: Drink: Restore 2d4 hit points over 1 turn. May make a DC 13 Con save to avoid nausea and vomiting, losing any potential additional healing from this potion.

Lore: Likely originating from the frozen wastes, rumored to contain essence of the ancient ice witch.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration, restoring a small amount of health per second.
DescriptionLore: Wearer recovers 1d3 hit points per turn. If worn in extreme cold, healing is doubled; in extreme heat, healing is halved. May attract the attention of ice spirits.

Lore: Favored by frontline soldiers of Demacia, it is often used by those who fight alongside weaker allies, or when defending fortifications.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and heals allies when nearby minions are executed. Grants bonus health and health regeneration.
DescriptionLore: When a blow would fell an ally, instead steel yourself and absorb the impact. Your ally is spared, and you gain vitality, becoming hale and hearty. Grants +2 to HP, and slowly recover 1 lost HP per turn.

Lore: Associated with Targon's ascended, granting enhanced mana regeneration and ability power.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability haste, mana regeneration, and bonus health. Provides a ward.
DescriptionLore: Upon attuning, the wielder recovers mana quickly. Once per day, may summon a spectral sentinel to watch over a location. Sentinel disappears after 8 hours or when danger is present.

Lore: Linked to the Watchers, ancient beings of the Freljordian ice, offering glimpses into their chilling power.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, mana regeneration, ability haste, and a ward-placing active.
DescriptionLore: Grants the wearer visions of the past, present, and possible futures. User risks madness as the visions are cold and uncaring. Save vs. Insanity each use.

Lore: Riftmaker is likely tied to the Black Rose, an organization known for dark magic and manipulating rifts for their own purposes.
DescriptionGame: Damage converts to true damage; healing scales with damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Bonds the user to an otherworldly entity. 1/day, convert damage to bypass armor. Accumulate corruption; upon reaching a threshold, heal HP equal to corruption. Risk: attracts unwanted attention from beyond.

Lore: Forged in the bitter cold, said to be able to freeze the very ground on which battles are fought. Possibly linked to the Ice Witch.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage and create a temporary frost area that slows enemies.
DescriptionLore: Attack deals +1d6 cold damage. Target must Save vs. Cold or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Ground freezes: difficult terrain in a 10' radius.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Targon, infused with celestial energies, it whispers forgotten truths to those who dare listen. Grants resilience in prolonged battles.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, mana, and ability power that increase over time.
DescriptionLore: Heal 1d6 hit points per turn, recover 1d4 mana. On a roll of '1' for either, hear a fragment of forgotten lore. DM determines relevance.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy. It might be linked to the Aspect of Twilight, enhancing map awareness.
DescriptionGame: Provides health and allows placement of Stealth Wards, granting vision in an area.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to Wisdom checks. Allows the user to cast 'See Invisible' once per day. The caster can see ethereal watchers for 8 turns if a WIS save is failed.

Lore: Likely forged by ancient Iceborn, the Runecarver's etchings resonate with forgotten glacial magic and Freljordian spirits. Could be associated with Lissandra.
DescriptionGame: Empowers basic attacks with bonus magic damage and grants movement speed on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save versus magic or be slowed for 1 round. Grants +1 to hit rolls against creatures with the 'Ice' descriptor.

Lore: Likely a relic of the ancient Iceborn, perhaps used in rituals to consume the power of primal runes.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and mana. Deals bonus magic damage. Increases max health.
DescriptionLore: Wearer heals 1d6 HP/Mana per turn. Attacks inflict +1 magic damage. Max HP permanently increased by 5 after combat where at least one foe is slain.

Lore: Favored by Demacian sentinels, this bulwark's runes deflect magic. Some whisper it was crafted by mageseekers, a twisted irony.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resistance to the wielder and nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to saves vs. magic. Allies within 30' gain +1 to saves. However, the bulwark hums with suppressed magic - a failed save results in a wild magic surge (GM's discretion).

Lore: Echoes resonate with Ionian spirit magic, amplifying spellcasting. Potentially tied to ancient monasteries or spirit realms.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic damage on spell cast and bonus movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Once per combat, after casting a spell, deal +1d6 magic damage with subsequent attacks, and move +10' for 1 round. Save vs. Magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits.

Lore: Associated with monks of Ionia seeking enlightenment and inner peace, enhancing their connection to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Grants AP and mana, restoring mana on spell cast.
DescriptionLore: Wearer can cast spells more often. 1-in-6 chance a spell cast doesn't expend a charge. The wearer experiences vivid dreams, potentially receiving cryptic advice.

Lore: Forged in the desert's heart, it whispers of ancient Ascended, their power now sand. A relic of forgotten empires.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield and a dash that empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, create a sand simulacrum to scout ahead. If broken, the next strike deals +1d6 damage, revealing weakness.

Lore: Implies a dark pact or ritual sacrifice within Noxus, possibly connected to the Crimson Circle or similar hemomancy cult.
DescriptionGame: Bonus attack damage that scales with bonus health.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls equal to your lost hit points. Upon reaching 0 hp, immediately die. The bargain is struck, but the blood price is absolute.

Lore: A relic from the Shadow Isles, possibly tied to ancient rituals enhancing predator instincts. It is tied to the hunger of the void.
DescriptionGame: On-hit, grants phantom hits, dealing bonus damage and applying on-hit effects a second time.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, a spectral tendril lashes out, seeking another nearby enemy. Roll a d6. On a 1, the tendril turns on the wielder, dealing 1d4 damage.

Lore: Favored by young Demacian soldiers for practice. Its simple design reflects Demacia's value of resourcefulness and practicality.
DescriptionGame: Damaging enemy champions grants a burst of movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Hurl a pebble with unnatural speed and accuracy. If it strikes true, you are granted +1 to initiative on your next turn as you exploit your foe's distraction.

Lore: Used by Demacian scouts to survey enemy positions. It could reveal hidden Noxian camps or Freljordian raiding parties before they strike.
DescriptionGame: Periodically reveal a small area at a distance.
DescriptionLore: Grants a fleeting glimpse through the veil of distance. 1/Day: See a 30ft radius area within 1 mile, but risk attracting unwanted attention (GM's discretion).

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have ties to the Black Rose, offering protection to mages delving into forbidden magic.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor and ability power, increasing armor gained upon killing enemy units.
DescriptionLore: The wearer gains +2 AC. Upon slaying a foe, gain +1 AC (max +15) until end of session. If AC reaches 15, wearer must save vs. magic or be controlled by arcane whispers.

Lore: Associated with undeath and pain, possibly linked to the Black Mist or souls trapped within the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage based on missing health, and heals the user.
DescriptionLore: On hit, target takes +1d6 necrotic damage per 10% health missing. User heals for damage dealt. Undead are immune to the damage, healing the user instead.

Lore: Forged in the Freljord, perhaps by a forgotten Ice Witch or a master blacksmith of the Winter's Claw. Grants lethality and armor penetration.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor penetration and a slowing effect on damaging abilities.
DescriptionLore: Ranged attacks cripple foes, reducing movement by 1/4 for 1d4 rounds, and ignores 20% of metal armor. The wielder gains +2 to hit armored foes.

Lore: Potentially tied to Lissandra or other Iceborn, grants vision and slows enemies. Once held immense power now a fragment.
DescriptionGame: Slows nearby enemies on ability cast. Grants bonus move speed and vision when near enemies.
DescriptionLore: Enemies failing a save vs. magic suffer -2 to hit. Those fleeing are easily tracked. Grants fleeting visions of enemies in the fog and snow.

Lore: Forged in Demacia, Sheen's magic resonates with righteousness, empowering the wielder's next strike with amplified force.
DescriptionGame: After using an ability, the next attack deals bonus magic damage.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, add +1d6 magic damage. This bonus damage will only trigger after casting a spell. The magic damage can be resisted as normal. The bonus lasts a single round.

Lore: Likely crafted by Demacian artificers, perhaps enchanted by mages, for scouting and defense against unseen threats in the wilderness.
DescriptionGame: Periodically grants a shield, offering temporary protection from damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, grants +2 AC against a single attack. If that attack misses, the Totem is depleted of power.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial aspect of the Guide, granting swift passage through the most perilous journeys. Often carried by pilgrims.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed to nearby allies when activated, empowering the next three attacks to deal additional damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, the wielder and allies gain +2 to movement and initiative for 3 turns. The next 3 attacks made gain +1 to hit and deal +1d4 damage.

Lore: Associated with the Aspects of Targon, channeling celestial energies and offering protection to allies through ethereal shields and swiftness.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed and empowers allies with a shield upon activation.
DescriptionLore: Caster and nearby allies gain +2 to save vs. fear and move 50% faster for 3 turns. After effect ends, caster must save vs. WIS DC 13 or be stunned for 1 turn.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be able to weaken even a Watcher's grip. Grants tenacity and cleanse effects.
DescriptionGame: Provides Tenacity, and a single-use active to remove all debuffs.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to saves versus charm and hold effects. Once per day, negate a magical effect that impairs movement or thought; this action is resolved before the effect.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists and pit fighters, enhancing their combat prowess in skirmishes. Some say it whispers secrets of forgotten techniques.
DescriptionGame: Challenge a champion, reducing their damage to you and granting bonus damage on hit.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking true, mark a foe. They suffer -2 to hit you, but you gain +1 to hit them and deal +2 damage. Lasts until sundown.

Lore: Likely acquired through less-than-reputable means in Bilgewater, perhaps involving deals with the Buhru or illicit ventures in the Serpent Isles.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus gold on minion kill. Limited uses.
DescriptionLore: Each use grants the bearer advantage on one haggling roll as if filled with plundered coin. Risk: On a fumble, the sack bursts, revealing fool's gold.

Lore: Favored by Ionian mages seeking to enhance their connection to the spirit realm and empower their spellcasting.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic penetration, allowing spells to deal more damage by bypassing enemy magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Wearer's spells ignore some magical defenses. Spells cast do +1 damage per level of the caster. Save vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round after casting a spell through the shoes.

Lore: Said to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, the Soul Sickle corrupts the wielder with dark intent and insatiable hunger.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and mana regeneration. Killing minions grants bonus gold.
DescriptionLore: Upon glutting on souls, wielder must test WIS or attack nearest creature. Grants +1 to hit and damage rolls. Failsafe: Upon death, Soul Sickle animates and attacks nearest non-wielder.

Lore: A relic of the Shadow Isles, possibly connected to lost rituals of life and death, now corrupted by undeath.
DescriptionGame: Grants spell vamp and on-hit damage, allowing the user to heal from damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Siphon life force from foes. A hit steals 1d4 HP, granting it to the wielder. Undead are immune; clerics resist.

Lore: Associated with spirits and protection against malevolent magic, perhaps used by sentinels or those venturing into the Shadow Isles.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resistance and health regeneration, mitigating magic damage taken.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to saves versus magic. Regenerate 1d3 hit points per turn unless damaged by fire, in which case, no regeneration.

Lore: Favored by mageseekers, rumored to be forged from petricite, a stone that nullifies magic, originating from Demacia.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and attack damage. Passively grants a magic damage shield when near enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, may negate a magical attack, turning it back upon the caster. However, all subsequent magic attacks against the wearer gain +1 to hit.

Lore: Forged in the ancient glaciers, this item resonates with the strength and endurance of the Freljord's primal spirits and legendary golems.
DescriptionGame: Bonus health, tenacity, and health regeneration for increased survivability in prolonged fights.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. petrification and cold damage. Once per day, can ignore one critical hit. Slowly heals 1hp/round unless damaged.

Lore: Associated with the Shadow Isles, potentially used by spectral beings or wraiths to enhance their magical abilities and sustain themselves.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic damage, mana sustain, and life steal against monsters.
DescriptionLore: User gains +2 to cast necromantic spells, recovers 1d4 hit points when draining life force from undead creatures. Potential risk of spectral possession on a fumble.

Lore: Associated with Ionian water spirits and the ebb and flow of magic, enhancing allies with its currents.
DescriptionGame: Heals and shields grant bonus Ability Power and Ability Haste to the ally.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting a healing or protective spell, the target gains +1 to cast magical spells and casts 1 round sooner as their magic is accelerated.

Lore: Forged with celestial magic, it resonates with champions touched by the stars, like Zoe or Aurelion Sol, amplifying their innate cosmic power.
DescriptionGame: Empowers abilities, granting increased range and damage based on the user's bonus mana and AP.
DescriptionLore: Upon attunement, the wielder's spells reach further and hit harder. Roll a d6; on a 1, the spell rebounds, affecting the caster instead.

Lore: Celestial power enhances champions, akin to the Aspect of Might's influence on chosen warriors.
DescriptionGame: Provides adaptive force, scaling with bonus health, granting increased damage output and survivability.
DescriptionLore: Upon wearing this item, the player gets +1 to hit and damage rolls. Furthermore, for every 10 hit points they have, they gain +1 to said rolls, as well as +1 to saving throws against fear.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it channels spiritual energy. Could be associated with the teachings of Karma.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and ability haste, scaling with mana spent.
DescriptionLore: User gains +1 to saves versus spells. Each spell cast adds +1 to AC for 1 round. If AC exceeds 20, manifest a protective ward until end of next round.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers. Bears the crest of a forgotten order of knights. Grants courage and resilience in battle.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and bonus gold on minion kills. Provides charges to consume for bonus damage.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. fear and poison. Once per day, may expend a charge to deal +1d4 damage on a successful melee attack. Carries 3 charges, replenished at dawn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks, wards provide temporary protection and awareness, aiding in meditation and defense against wayward spirits.
DescriptionGame: Places an invisible, fragile ward that grants vision in a small area for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Grants a brief glimpse of the unseen. Save versus WIS or attract unwanted attention from spirits. Ward decays after 1 turn, or instantly if touched by unnatural beings.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists, its quickening hum resonates with the spirit realm. Often used in ceremonies and duels to quicken the participants.
DescriptionGame: Provides attack speed and ability haste, enhancing rapid strikes and spellcasting.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to initiative. On a successful hit, target must save versus Paralysis or be unable to act next round. Stacks with haste spells for potentially devastating effect.

Lore: Forged in the icy peaks of the Freljord, channeling the raw power of lightning storms. Said to be wielded by ancient stormcallers.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the next attack with bonus damage and slows the target.
DescriptionLore: Next melee attack deals +1d6 lightning damage and target must SAVE vs Paralysis or be slowed (half move) for 1 round. Recharges only in electrical storm or after imbibing potion of speed.

Lore: Favored by Noxian commanders for its brutal efficiency, allowing swift advances and crushing enemy lines. Potentially forged by the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, also grants movement speed.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save versus STR or be knocked prone. Grants +1 to initiative when charging into combat or fleeing. Movement is doubled for a short time.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten Ionian master, rumored to channel storm spirits. Its raw power is sought by those who desire unmatched striking speed.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage and slow the target.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, the wielder's spirit leaves their body in the form of lightning, teleporting them 10' in a straight line and stunning any creature they pass through for 1 round.

Lore: Associated with Darius, though it may be a weapon used by other Noxian commanders to break enemy ranks and inspire fear.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, also grants movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Once per turn, slam the blade to inflict STR damage and reduce enemy movement to half for one round; 1/day, increase movement by 50% for one round.

Lore: Forged with celestial fire, it is reminiscent of artifacts wielded by the Solari, warding off darkness.
DescriptionGame: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies, increased damage to monsters and minions.
DescriptionLore: Grants a constant aura of heat, dealing 1d4 fire damage to those within melee range. Undead and creatures of the night suffer double damage.

Lore: Likely crafted by Ionian spirit walkers, enhances magical bonds and connection. Perhaps used during meditation or communion with spirits.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus mana and ability haste, empowering the user's connection with their ally.
DescriptionLore: Wearer can cast spells through a willing ally within 30ft. Ally takes half damage from the spell. Potential for disastrous backfires if the bond is broken mid-cast.

Lore: Likely created by a Noxian artificer, its crude construction suggests it's meant for frontline soldiers.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed towards enemies, and an AOE slow upon reaching them.
DescriptionLore: Move with unnatural speed toward a foe. Upon contact, those nearby must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Forged on Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, assisting those who protect the vulnerable. Often used by the Rakkor.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and executes minions to grant gold to an ally.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to AC. Once per day, may smite a creature of negligible HP (1 hp or less). Target turns to gold dust, 1d6 gold pieces appear at the wearer's feet.

Lore: Associated with celestial magic, often carried by mages seeking to amplify their connection to the heavens and increase their mana reserves.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus mana and mana regeneration, stacking mana upon spell cast.
DescriptionLore: User gains +1 to cast spells. Each successful spell cast permanently adds a charge to the Tear. On 10 charges, roll a d6. On a 6, spell permanently improved (DM's discretion, damage/range/etc.)

Lore: Favored by monks and traveling merchants, allowing for swift travel to remote temples or bustling marketplaces across Ionia.
DescriptionGame: After a delay, teleport to a target allied structure.
DescriptionLore: Upon utterance of command word, user vanishes and reappears next to designated structure. Mispronunciation or flawed structure diagrams risk arrival inside walls (1d6 damage) or miles away (1d20 miles in random direction).

Lore: Potentially tied to void corruption experiments performed during the height of the Ascended empire. Could be tied to Bel'Veth.
DescriptionGame: Empowers the holder, granting increased attack damage, ability power, and tenacity for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to hit and damage rolls, and advantage on saves vs. charm and fear. Duration: 3 rounds. After, suffer -1 to all rolls for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Favored by Noxian bounty hunters and debt collectors, it ensures debts are paid, one way or another, often associated with the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Grants lethality and critical strike chance. Executes enemies below a health threshold, granting bonus gold.
DescriptionLore: On a successful hit, the target must SAVE vs DEATH or instantly die if below the item user's level. On a successful hit and death, the item user is granted 1d6 gold.

Lore: Associated with the Black Rose, it likely enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience, maybe connected to LeBlanc or Swain.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, ability haste, and damage reduction after casting ultimate.
DescriptionLore: Grants +3 to saves vs charm and fear after casting a ritual. Lasts 1d4 rounds. Possible mishap on a roll of 1: target becomes hostile.

Lore: Favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, each spike is rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.
DescriptionGame: Reflects damage and inflicts grievous wounds to attackers when hit by basic attacks.
DescriptionLore: Creature suffers damage when it hits you with a melee attack. Chance target also suffers -2 to all attack rolls for 1d4 rounds due to festering wounds.

Lore: A discarded coin from a bygone Shuriman dynasty, hinting at the empire's forgotten wealth and the transience of power. Likely a trinket of a fallen emperor.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and mana upon nearby enemy minion deaths. Encourages support role activity and sustain.
DescriptionLore: Coin whispers secrets of past eras. Spend coin to possibly glimpse future, but each use ages the holder, imposing cumulative -1 to all rolls.

Lore: Likely owned by a powerful Ice Witch, its magic allows the bearer to glimpse echoes of the past and slow their foes.
DescriptionGame: Slows nearby enemies and grants vision of them for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, user may cast 'Temporal Snare'. Target must Save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Reveals invisible foes within 30' for 1 round. Item crumbles to dust after 7 uses.

Lore: Said to be favored by nomadic ascetics who dwell on the slopes of Mount Targon, seeking enlightenment and offering aid to weary travelers.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration, mana regeneration, and a small amount of gold over time.
DescriptionLore: Wearer recovers 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana per turn when not in combat, and has a 1-in-6 chance of finding a lost coin or useful pebble each day.

Lore: Likely once belonging to a Frost Priestess, the item hums with dormant power, awaiting a wielder worthy of channeling the glacial energies within.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and mana regeneration on damaging spells against champions. Transforms into Fated Guide when quest is completed.
DescriptionLore: Upon casting a spell, roll a d6. On a 6, recover 1d4 mana. When 5 successful spells are cast, the edge transforms into a Fated Guide; a powerful staff.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, offering protection to its wielder and empowering their allies.
DescriptionGame: Grants health, health regeneration, and ability haste. Grants gold to allies when nearby enemies are slain.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 AC. Once per day, may touch an ally; they gain +1 on their next save vs. death or being charmed/frightened. The wearer only gains half XP from encounters.

Lore: Brewed with mystical glacial water, favored by Iceborn. Provides sustenance and inner resolve for surviving in harsh environments.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and mana. Grants a small burst of movement speed upon consumption.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 on saves vs. cold and starvation. Upon consumption, heal 1d6 hp and move at double speed for 1 round. May attract unwanted attention from winter spirits.

Lore: Associated with nomadic tribes charting the shifting sands, or perhaps ancient Ascended beings who needed to survey their vast empire. Used to observe enemies.
DescriptionGame: Provides vision and map control through the placement of wards after jungling.
DescriptionLore: Grants the ability to leave behind an invisible, immobile eye that sees all within a 120' radius for 6 turns. The user is not notified if the eye is disturbed.

Lore: Often carried by Noxian legionnaires on long marches, a smaller, less potent version of the elixirs used by the Trifarix.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased health, tenacity, and champion size for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Drink: gain +2 to saves vs. fear and intimidation, +1d4 temp HP. Size increases by 1 category. Duration: 5 turns. Upon expiration, -1 to saves vs. fear for 1 turn.

Lore: Commonly carried by Noxian soldiers before battle, this elixir is rumored to be brewed with secret ingredients to inspire aggression.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage and lifesteal for a short duration upon consumption.
DescriptionLore: Drink: +2 to hit and damage rolls for 5 rounds. Afterwards, -1 to AC as the rage subsides. Possible frenzy.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking versatile power, rumored to be inspired by ancient fighting styles. Often sought after by pit fighters in Noxus.
DescriptionGame: Provides balanced stats, enhanced attack after spell cast, and movement speed on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit roll, if a spell was cast in the last round, deal +1d6 damage. If a hit connects, move an additional 10ft this round. User gains +1 to hit, damage and AC.

Lore: Likely crafted by Noxian alchemists or engineers, designed for quick assaults and area denial. Could be associated with Singed's experiments.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed towards enemies, upon close proximity, it unleashes a shockwave that slows nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, user may move at double speed toward a foe. Upon contact, all within 10' must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Likely related to lost souls or spectral entities of the Shadow Isles, perhaps used in rituals to bind or control spirits.
DescriptionGame: Periodically applies a stacking magic damage and movement speed buff when dealing or taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Upon use, target foe must SAVE vs. magic or be cursed. On subsequent damage, the wearer's speed is doubled for the round and the foe suffers -1 to hit.

Lore: A relic from the Shadow Isles, rumored to be tied to spirits seeking to sow confusion and dread among the living.
DescriptionGame: Sends out two spectral entities that seek out nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Casts 'Phantom Summons'. Two incorporeal stalkers appear, moving at incredible speed to harass the nearest living beings, sowing terror with icy touch. Victims must SAVE vs. Magic or FLEE for 1d4 turns.

Lore: Favored by those who navigate treacherous currents, Typhoon Claws are rumored to be imbued with the spirit of a raging storm.
DescriptionGame: Empowers basic attacks, granting temporary attack damage and movement speed on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, a surge of elemental air grants +2 to hit and run checks for 1 round. A critical hit unleashes a localized wind blast, potentially pushing foes back 5 ft.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist and the anguished spirits of the Shadow Isles, it seems to amplify their despair.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage over time to nearby enemies and heals the wearer for a portion of the damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: Aura: 10' radius. Living beings: -1 to Morale checks. Undead: +1 to hit. Drains 1d4 HP per round from living beings, heals wearer same amount. Chance of attracting spectres.

Lore: Likely crafted by a hemomancer within Noxus. Perhaps associated with Vladmir or one of his apprentices.
DescriptionGame: Grants the wielder lifesteal, restoring health based on damage dealt to enemies.
DescriptionLore: Each strike fills the wielder with stolen vitality. Roll a d6; on a 1, the wielder risks succumbing to bloodlust, attacking the nearest creature, friend or foe.

Lore: Likely used by Demacian armies for morale and coordination. Could be associated with the Dauntless Vanguard.
DescriptionGame: Empowers nearby allied lane minions and reduces damage from enemy towers.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to morale checks for allies within 30'. Enemy siege attacks suffer -1 to hit. Banner must be planted; moving breaks the effect.

Lore: Vespertide's enchantments hint at ties to dark magic, perhaps related to the Black Rose or forgotten Noxian rituals.
DescriptionGame: After casting your ultimate, gain bonus move speed and magic damage on-hit for a duration.
DescriptionLore: Upon uttering words of great power, briefly gain +2 to movement and inflict 1d6 magic damage with melee attacks. Duration: 5 rounds. Save vs. Magic to negate.

Lore: Favored by young mages in Ionia, Doran's Ring is often seen as a stepping stone to more powerful arcane artifacts.
DescriptionGame: Provides Ability Power, Health, and Mana Regeneration.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to cast spells. User heals 1hp every turn. Expend ring's magic to reroll a failed magic check.

Lore: Horns are commonly used among the Freljord tribes to signal a coming raid. It could be used by the Winter's Claw or the Avarosan.
DescriptionGame: Gain health regeneration after taking damage. Blocks a small amount of damage from enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. fear after taking damage. Additionally, once per day, wearer can negate 2 points of damage from a single attack.

Lore: Bred in the harsh climates of the Freljord, these pups are favored by those seeking to ignite a fire in their hearts.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage on next attack and applies a slow.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, add +1 fire damage die to weapon. Target must make a save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by Demacian scouts, these wards reveal hidden threats, embodying the kingdom's vigilance against mages and Noxian spies.
DescriptionGame: Provides vision and disables enemy wards in a small area, revealing invisible units.
DescriptionLore: A glass bauble that detects arcane trickery and illusory figments; creatures attempting invisibility within 30' suffer disadvantage on stealth checks. Lasts until broken (AC 9, 1 HP).

Lore: Used by Ionian monks to quickly recover from wounds sustained during meditation or combat. Could be related to the Spirit Blossom festival.
DescriptionGame: Instantly restores a moderate amount of health over a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing this potion restores 2d4 hit points. Side effects may include temporary visions of spirits or minor prophetic dreams for 1d4 turns.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks for centuries to protect sacred groves from outsiders.
DescriptionGame: Places an invisible ward that grants vision of the surrounding area for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: When cast, the user becomes invisible to entities with less than 8 INT, but can do nothing other than observe. Ward lasts 6 turns or until dispelled.

Lore: Associated with the Void and Watchers through the summoning of Rift Herald. Void corruption spreads from the host to the surrounding area.
DescriptionGame: Summons the Rift Herald to siege enemy turrets, empowering nearby allied champions.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, summon a powerful but unintelligent voidling to attack a specified target. Allies near the voidling gain +1 on attack rolls, but risk corruption and madness.

Lore: Favored by the Fortune's loyal crew, providing extra gold after a kill. Could be associated with gangs or freebooters of Bilgewater.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus gold on kill, shared with the support champion.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a foe, 1d6 silver pieces are found near the corpse, divvied to nearby allies. On a roll of 1, the gold is fool's gold and vanishes.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, these boots enhance mental clarity and swiftness, embodying Ionian ideals of balance and enlightenment. Connected to the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Reduces cooldowns on abilities and summoner spells, and grants increased movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Wearer casts spells and prayers with blinding speed (reduce casting time by 2 turns) and moves with unnerving swiftness (+1 to initiative). However, spirits are drawn to the wearer.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, perhaps linked to a celestial being granting swiftness and adaptability.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed and reduces the effectiveness of slows.
DescriptionLore: Wearer ignores movement penalties from terrain and gains +1 to Dexterity saving throws against immobilization. Duration: 1 turn.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the B. F. Sword is rumored to be forged in blood magic, amplifying the wielder's strength.
DescriptionGame: Grants a large amount of attack damage, increasing the potency of physical attacks.
DescriptionLore: Confers +4 to hit and damage rolls. Upon scoring a critical hit, the wielder must make a DC 12 Wisdom save or fly into a bloodthirsty rage for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Commonly used by Ionian villagers and trained acolytes alike; a simple tool with many uses. Often enchanted by novice practitioners.
DescriptionGame: Increases attack speed. Grants the wielder a small edge in swift strikes.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 on initiative rolls. On a critical hit, target must save versus Dexterity or drop their held item.

Lore: Dwarven artisans in the Freljord, famed for their metalwork, forge Pickaxes. Used for mining rare Truesilver deposits deep within the mountains.
DescriptionGame: Increases attack damage, aiding in champion combat effectiveness through enhanced physical prowess.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking true, target must SAVE vs. STR or weapon sticks fast! Requires an action to dislodge. On a critical strike, target is knocked prone.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, it's rumored to be imbued with the essence of ancient fire mages, fueling their destructive power.
DescriptionGame: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies, increased damage to minions and monsters.
DescriptionLore: Creatures near the wielder suffer 1d4 fire damage per round; flammable objects ignite. Armor saves vs. fire. Extra damage vs. plant-based monsters or constructs.

Lore: Associated with celestial bodies and the magic of Targon. Grants resilience and mana, potentially linked to the Aspects.
DescriptionGame: Grants health and mana. Upon leveling up, restores mana and health based on a percentage.
DescriptionLore: Drink deep from the Catalyst, never thirst for spells again, at the cost of aging as fast as the mountains! 1 in 6 chance to gain one level if drained completely.

Lore: Favored by Noxian generals for its brutal efficiency, the blade inflicts grievous wounds, hindering regeneration and healing on the battlefield.
DescriptionGame: Deals physical damage and applies Grievous Wounds, reducing the effectiveness of healing on the target for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: On hit: target cannot regain hit points through spells or abilities. Potions and natural healing are at 1/4 effectiveness. Lasts 8 seconds, or until target rests.

Lore: Often reinforced with True Ice, Giant's Belts are favored by hardy Freljordian warriors and chieftains for their resilience.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health, increasing survivability in combat.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 hit point per level. If reduced to 0 hit points, wearer may make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On success, they are instead reduced to 1 hit point.

Lore: Favored by low-ranking Noxian officers to protect from magical attacks. Some speculate it's made from captive mages' essence.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resist and a shield that absorbs magic damage when taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to saves versus spells. Upon taking magic damage, negates the next spell entirely, then crumbles to dust.

Lore: Associated with nomadic tribes navigating the harsh Freljordian landscape, seeking ancient ruins and forgotten paths.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and experience over time. Generates a ward after leaving spawn.
DescriptionLore: Tracks the nearest source of untapped magic or ancient power; glows brighter when near ley lines. Once per day, casts 'phantom ward' (lasts 1 turn, 10' radius).

Lore: Favored by Noxian arena fighters, the Brutalizer enhances aggression and lethality, embodying the empire's values.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage and armor penetration. Previously granted cooldown reduction.
DescriptionLore: Weapon grants +1 to hit and damage rolls. On a critical hit, target's AC is permanently reduced by 1 (cumulative) due to shattered armor.

Lore: Likely crafted in Demacia, given its resistance to magic and the nation's anti-magic stance. May be related to Galio or the petricite forests.
DescriptionGame: Provides magic resist and ability power. Absorbs some magic damage via a shield when taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to saves vs. magical effects. Once per day, absorb a magical attack, converting damage to temporary hit points.
