Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness, its origins trace back to ancient movement techniques studied in monasteries.
DescriptionGame: Increases movement speed and critical strike chance.
DescriptionLore: Bestows +1 to initiative rolls. When charging into melee, roll +1 to hit. On a critical hit, move an additional 1d4 hexes after the attack.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, the Axiom Arc whispers promises of swift victories and unforgettable executions. It may have ties to the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Refunds a large portion of your ultimate's cooldown upon scoring a takedown.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a worthy foe, roll under your Intelligence score. If successful, reduce your XP needed to level by 10%. If you fail, an enemy’s spirit haunts your dreams that night.

Lore: Forged in the Shadow Isles, it corrupts the wielder, draining life and empowering attacks. Linked to the Ruination and potentially Viego.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage based on enemy health, steals movement speed, and heals the wielder.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save vs death or lose 1d4 STR and grant it to the wielder as HP. On a fumble, user must save vs death or be charmed as per the spell by an unknown entity.

Lore: Crafted with materials echoing Ascended might, its creation may be tied to a powerful mage seeking to restore Shurima's glory.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus gold and experience upon assisting in champion kills.
DescriptionLore: The bearer gains uncanny luck attracting allies during battle. Allies are more likely to survive, even against overwhelming odds, and share knowledge of hidden treasures (roll +1 on encounter checks).

Lore: Likely tied to the Black Mist and the life-draining magic of the Shadow Isles. Could be related to the Ruination.
DescriptionGame: Heals allies when dealing damage and grants them bonus magic resist. Provides healing and ability power.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck by spells while blooming must Save vs. Death or become withered, taking 1d4 damage each round as they slowly turn into spectral flora. Nearby allies are briefly fortified.

Lore: Crafted by celestial artisans, it is said to be imbued with the power to shape dreams and destinies, influenced by Zoe.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus Ability Haste and empowers healing and shielding abilities.
DescriptionLore: Heal allies at range (1d6 hp). Protect allies from attacks for one round; must rest to regain ability. Grants +1 to cast dream magic.

Lore: Said to be tied to ancient Ionian magic, possibly related to spirit energy manipulation techniques or a lost sword-fighting style.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, critical strike chance, and mana regeneration based on damage dealt.
DescriptionLore: On a critical hit, the wielder regains expended magical energy, briefly regaining clarity and focus in battle. High chance of addiction.

Lore: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, rumored to have been touched by the spirit of a long-dormant ice giant.
DescriptionGame: Reduces attack speed of nearby enemies and grants armor and mana.
DescriptionLore: Nearby creatures suffer -2 to attack rolls. Grants +3 AC. User gains +1 to WIL saves vs. cold.

Lore: Associated with ambitious Noxian artificers seeking to enhance mobility and burst damage. Could be linked to a secretive hextech research division.
DescriptionGame: Dashes a short distance and fires projectiles, dealing magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, propel forward 30' and unleash a blast dealing 2d6 damage to all within 10'. Save vs. Dex or be knocked prone. Requires a rare power cell to recharge.

Lore: Favored by reavers and shipwrights, especially useful for claiming coastal territory and isolated outposts without drawing the full fleet's attention.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor, magic resist, and attack damage. Empowered siege minions; nearby allies get less XP.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 AC and +2 to hit when fighting near structures. Allies within 30' suffer -1 to hit. Siege attacks do double damage. A cursed item for wanderers.

Lore: Forged in Bilgewater, associated with sea monster hunting. Grants the user the ability to take down any monstrosity in the seas.
DescriptionGame: Every third attack deals true damage. Provides attack damage, attack speed, and critical strike chance.
DescriptionLore: On every third successful attack roll, ignore the target's armor. If the target is a sea monster, deal double damage. Grants +2 to hit rolls.

Lore: Crafted by a Demacian weaponsmith to pierce even the thickest armor, it might have been used in wars against Noxus or the Freljord.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor penetration and increased damage against tanky targets based on the health difference.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck by this weapon have their AC temporarily lowered, and those with high HP totals suffer extra damage, representing a chink in their defenses found and exploited.

Lore: Crafted with sands from Shurima and imbued with ancient magic, it offers protection against curses and debilitating magics.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, magic resist, and a cleanse that removes crowd control effects.
DescriptionLore: Wearer is immune to paralysis, petrification, and charm. A saving throw is allowed against spells of enslavement or domination, with a +4 bonus. Once per day, the wielder can negate an ongoing magical effect, such as a binding spell.

Lore: Favored by Noxian duelists and executioners, its whisper erodes even the mightiest defenses, ensuring a swift end.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor penetration and Grievous Wounds, reducing healing received by the target.
DescriptionLore: On hit: Target's AC is reduced by 2 for 1d4 rounds. Further, any healing received is halved for the duration. Usable once per round.

Lore: Favored by duelists and dancers across Ionia, the Phantom Dancer is said to grant its wearer supernatural speed and grace.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, attack speed, critical strike chance, and movement speed; also grants phasing and a lifeline.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to AC and +2 to hit when fighting one-on-one. On a failed save vs. death, instead go to 1hp and flee the fight at double speed (save vs. fear).

Lore: Enhances ranged attacks, reminiscent of Ionian archers who imbue their shots with mystical energy for greater reach and impact.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased attack range and energizes attacks to deal bonus magic damage on hit.
DescriptionLore: Ranged attacks gain +50% range; successful hits deal +1d6 lightning damage. Once per day, may ignore cover penalties. Mishaps arc to nearest ally, dealing 1d6 lightning damage.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins. Associated with the Black Rose and Leblanc, for their ability to manipulate and break through defenses.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to enemies with shields, briefly reducing their shield.
DescriptionLore: On hit, target's AC is penalized by -2 [1 round]. If target relied on magical protection, they must save vs. Spells or also lose 1d4 hp.

Lore: Likely crafted by a forgotten Freljordian tribe, it evokes themes of protection and winter resilience, potentially tied to the Winter's Claw.
DescriptionGame: Heals allies and grants them bonus movement speed when near the user.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to AC to nearby allies and advantage on saves vs. cold. Once per day, user may summon a spectral sled dog to pull them a short distance.

Lore: Associated with Ionian storm mages and the harnessing of raw magical energy into directed bursts, reminiscent of Ionian traditions.
DescriptionGame: Periodically emits chain lightning, damaging multiple nearby enemies on attack.
DescriptionLore: Grants the ability to discharge stored electricity, dealing 1d6 lightning damage to a primary target and arcing to up to 2 nearby foes; Save vs. Lightning or be stunned for 1 round.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power, potentially linked to the Aspect of the Twilight or the Aspect of War.
DescriptionGame: First attack after casting a spell crits, heals you and grants armor pen. Cooldown is based on base AD.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe after invoking a celestial power, the wielder heals 1d6 HP and ignores the foe's armor for one attack. Recharge after combat.

Lore: Associated with Demacian vanguard tactics, enabling swift and fortified advances. Could be connected to the Dauntless Vanguard.
DescriptionGame: Empowers siege, granting bonus damage to structures. Nearby allies gain increased movement speed when moving towards turrets or structures.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to siege checks. Allies within 30' gain +2 to movement when charging fortifications or fortified positions. Structures automatically take maximum damage for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Used by sentinels and mages of the White City, allowing greater reach and vigilance against threats both seen and unseen.
DescriptionGame: Increases ability haste, health, and allows placement of more wards. Also increases ward range.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to Wisdom saving throws against illusions and reveals hidden enemies within 60'. The holder can maintain one extra active magical ward or trap.

Lore: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, it's said to ward off the chilling touch of the Watchers.
DescriptionGame: Provides mana, armor, and ability haste. Converts mana into health and grants a shield when near enemies.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus cold. When in danger, a spectral barrier absorbs 1d6 damage, but requires 1d4 turns to recharge. If barrier breaks, wearer must test vs. paralysis or be frozen solid.

Lore: Likely tied to the Void and the Watchers. Possibly a tool used by the Ascended in their battles against the Void.
DescriptionGame: Periodically summons a Void grub that explodes on enemies.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, summon a 1 HD voidling that explodes for 1d6 damage in a 5' radius. On a fumble, the voidling attacks the summoner.

Lore: Associated with the Buhru tribe and sea monster hunting rituals of Bilgewater. Possibly used to appease or control sea beasts.
DescriptionGame: Deals physical damage and slows enemies. Applies grievous wounds.
DescriptionLore: Target suffers -2 to saves vs. poison. Anyone eating creature struck with this weapon must test vs. paralyzation or become paralyzed for 1d4 turns.

Lore: Forged in the heart of a dying star, the Black Hole Gauntlet is rumored to be connected to the Aspect of the Void.
DescriptionGame: Periodically pulls nearby enemies closer, dealing magic damage based on their maximum health.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, touch the gauntlet to create a 10' radius sphere, those inside must make a DC 15 Strength save or be pulled 5' closer to the center, taking 1d6 damage per character level.

Lore: Forged in the darkest Noxian forges, whispered to be infused with souls of conquered foes. Linked to the Black Rose.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage after dashing, or exiting stealth, and grants armor penetration.
DescriptionLore: On a hit after moving 40ft in a single round, deal +1d6 damage. Further, attacks are made as if the target's AC is 2 less.

Lore: Crafted by Noxian artificers, the Detonation Orb is rumored to utilize forbidden hemomancy for explosive power, favored by demolition squads.
DescriptionGame: Deals area damage after a delay. Triggers on-hit effects. Good for wave clear and burst.
DescriptionLore: Orb deals 3d6 fire damage to all within 10ft. Save vs. Breath for half damage. Those slain by the Orb explode dealing 1d6 fire damage to those within 5ft.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins and spies. Grants the wielder the element of surprise, negating an enemy's awareness.
DescriptionGame: Grants invisibility after killing an enemy champion. Next attack deals bonus damage, especially against wards. Disables traps.
DescriptionLore: Upon slaying a foe, vanish from sight (as per Invisibility spell). First strike deals +1d6 damage and bypasses armor if target is unawares. Pass unseen through magical wards and mundane traps.

Lore: Likely created by hemomancers in Noxus, Flesheater could be associated with the Black Rose or a warlord seeking power through blood magic.
DescriptionGame: Grants increasing damage and lifesteal as the wearer damages enemies in combat.
DescriptionLore: Upon a hit, wielder gains +1 to hit and damage rolls until the end of combat. For every three successful hits, they recover 1d4 hit points. The blade whispers promises of power.

Lore: Favored by fortune tellers and swindlers alike. The blade is rumored to have been first owned by a card shark known as 'The River King'.
DescriptionGame: On hit, grants a stacking buff that increases critical strike chance, lost on being hit.
DescriptionLore: Upon a successful hit, the wielder gains +1 Luck modifier to the next roll, stacking. Upon being hit, the wielder is cursed, resulting in -1 Luck modifier.

Lore: Associated with the Kinkou Order, this jitte might have been wielded to maintain balance and discipline.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus armor and magic resist, reducing damage from enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 AC. Once per day, deflect a single attack; attacker takes damage equal to your level. Requires Lawful alignment to attune.

Lore: Crafted in the Shadow Isles, it drains the life force of enemies, possibly linked to the Black Mist's power.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus damage and movement speed on champion damage; cooldown per champion.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, inflict 1d6 necrotic damage. If the target dies this turn, move again this turn with +2 to movement.

Lore: A tool used by the Harrowing's reapers, it enhances their ability to collect souls. Connected to the Black Mist and spectral entities.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage based on the target's missing health, increasing execute potential.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, target must save vs Death or take double damage. Undead are immune. Wielder must make a Wisdom save after use or become shaken.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to briefly grant the wielder the aspect of the divine.
DescriptionGame: Grants high attack speed and bonus damage for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, gain +4 to hit and double weapon damage for 1 round. Afterwards, -2 to hit for 1d4 rounds due to divine aftershock. If the wielder is a Cleric of a rival god, they take 1d6 damage.

Lore: Favored by temple archers, these items echo the teachings of precision and inner balance, principles deeply rooted in Ionian martial arts.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage, attack speed, and critical strike chance, enhancing ranged damage output.
DescriptionLore: Ranged attacks gain +1 to hit and damage. On a critical hit, the target must save versus Wisdom or be stunned for one round, representing the perfect shot finding a pressure point.

Lore: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to offer protection against celestial wrath and the dangers of the ascent.
DescriptionGame: Provides health regeneration and damage reduction from champion attacks. Grants bonus movement speed when near an ally.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to Saves vs. Spells and missile attacks. When within 30' of another character, gain +2 to movement; if damaged, both must Save vs. Paralysis or be unable to move for 1 round.

Lore: A hybrid weapon favored by those who blend magic and might, like Viktor. Potentially once belonging to a Hemomancer for blood magic.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage, grants lifesteal and spell vamp, and active damage that slows the target.
DescriptionLore: On Hit: 1d4+1 magic damage; Target is slowed, -2 to movement for 1 round; Heals wielder for damage dealt (cap 8hp/round).

Lore: May be connected to the Black Rose. Grants empowerments at the cost of health, a common theme in Noxian pacts.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage to yourself to deal damage to enemies, and gain movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Sacrifice HP: deal +1d6 damage; Move with haste, +5' movement that round. 1 in 6 chance of attracting unwanted attention from dark entities.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten aspect of Targon, the Wordless Promise binds two champions, sharing their burdens and bolstering their resolve.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health and ability haste. Periodically heals your most wounded ally. Healing them grants you movement speed.
DescriptionLore: As an action, touch an ally to grant them temporary HP. If they are reduced to zero HP before your next turn, you may choose to take the damage instead, appearing adjacent to them.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness in combat. The enchanted boots whisper forgotten techniques, enhancing reflexes and agility.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed. Passively grants bonus tenacity and slow resist.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves +2" per round. Saving throws against being stunned or slowed gain +2. If the wearer fails the saving throw, they only suffer half of the duration/effect.

Lore: Favored by Noxian scouts, the device is rumored to have been reverse-engineered from ancient Shuriman surveillance technology.
DescriptionGame: Reveals and disables nearby wards and traps for a short duration. Grants movement speed towards revealed wards.
DescriptionLore: As an action, reveal hidden threats (DC 13 WIS save to resist). Grants +2 to move silently near revealed threats, but all others gain advantage to detect you.

Lore: Potentially used by Demacian soldiers. Grants resilience and damage based on fortitude, embodying Demacian ideals.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage based on max health. Provides bonus armor and magic resist.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 AC per 10 current HP. On a crit, deal +1d4 damage per 10 max HP. If reduced to 0 HP, wearer makes a DC 15 CON save, or is slain outright.

Lore: Likely tied to a Freljordian tribe known for raiding. The blade may have been used to plunder from rival tribes or outsiders.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold upon killing a unit and increased critical strike chance.
DescriptionLore: Upon a kill, wielder gains 1d4 silver pieces. Additionally, rolls of '1' on attack dice are rerolled, once per turn.

Lore: Associated with the Black Mist emanating from the Shadow Isles, potentially used by those who seek to manipulate its power.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and vision upon damaging enemy champions with abilities or attacks. Transforms into Harrowing Crescent.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, 1d4 temporary HP are granted, and a spectral image is revealed. Once 5 images are seen, the scythe transforms; the wielder's max HP is permanently reduced by 1.

Lore: Commonly used by mageseekers to quickly return to base after long missions, it is associated with Demacia's infrastructure and control.
DescriptionGame: Instantly restores mana and returns the champion to their base.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing the blue pill allows immediate return to a designated safe haven. All accumulated wounds and fatigue are miraculously healed upon arrival. However, this escape route is one-way only; the character cannot return to their departure point.

Lore: Worn by pit fighters and martial artists across Ionia, these gloves are rumored to be blessed by a forgotten spirit of perseverance.
DescriptionGame: Grants critical strike chance. Useful for champions that rely on auto attacks.
DescriptionLore: Wearer’s attacks deal +1 damage and threaten a Critical Hit on a roll of 19-20. On a critical hit, deal double damage and inflict Broken status for 1 round.

Lore: Forged in the heart of the Noxian empire, it is rumored to have been wielded by a powerful warlord during the early expansions.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield after dashing, and increased damage based on missing health.
DescriptionLore: When the wielder is brought low, they may call upon the blade's inherent power, granting them +4 to AC for 1d4 rounds. On a hit, the blade deals +1d6 damage for each point of AC granted.

Lore: Said to be crafted by long-lost seers from Mount Targon, this relic enhances one's ability to perceive hidden truths and foresee future events.
DescriptionGame: Provides vision and reveals invisible units in an area. Grants bonus ability power.
DescriptionLore: Confers +2 to WIS checks related to perception and divination. Once per day, grants a glimpse of a possible future, though its accuracy is suspect (50%).

Lore: Favored by Noxian alchemists, it enhances plague warfare, spreading virulent concoctions among their enemies.
DescriptionGame: Grants Ability Haste and Ability Power. Imposes Grievous Wounds on enemies damaged by allies.
DescriptionLore: Upon a successful hit: Victim tests CON or suffers -2 to future CON tests against disease for 1d4 turns; allies' attacks inflict festering wounds.

Lore: Said to be woven from captured starlight by the Solari, granting resilience against the night. Perhaps a relic from the Rune Wars.
DescriptionGame: Periodically damages nearby enemies. Grants bonus health and magic resistance.
DescriptionLore: Radiates dim light, 5' radius. Once per dawn, unleash a burst of searing light: 2d6 damage to undead, 1d6 to others within 10'. Grants +1 to saves vs. magic and poison.

Lore: Drawn from the purest glacial springs, rumored to possess restorative properties known only to ancient ice witch covens. Used by hardy explorers.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and mana over time. Refills upon visiting the shop.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing this potion restores 1d6 hit points and/or MP. Flask refills after a day of rest in a settlement. Prolonged use may attract unwanted attention from frost witches.

Lore: Associated with forgotten Shadow Isles rituals and potent, but corrupting magic, the Deathfire Grasp was a tool for amplifying dark sorcery.
DescriptionGame: Greatly increased the wielder's magic damage for a short duration, amplifying burst potential.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, inflict +3 damage with a magic attack. The wielder ages 1d4 months and is one step closer to the Shadow Isles.

Lore: Implies a connection to consuming souls or life force, potentially linked to Mordekaiser or Thresh's artifacts.
DescriptionGame: On-hit damage that scales with takedowns, granting bonus magic damage.
DescriptionLore: Creature gains +1 to hit and damage for each soul devoured. Upon death, all devoured souls are released as specters.

Lore: Crafted by a forgotten order of Ionian mages, rumored to enhance the user's connection to the spirit realm and the magic within.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power, health, and mana regeneration. Provides additional damage against minions.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to magic-user rolls. Once per day, regain 1d4 lost spell slots. However, spirits now whisper erroneous secrets in the wearer's ears.

Lore: The Edge of Finality hums with the echoes of spirit realm blades. Perfected by Ionian weapon masters.
DescriptionGame: Grants AD, lethality and a spell shield when at low health, increasing damage.
DescriptionLore: Bestows +3 to hit and damage. When HP is at 2 or less, gain invulnerability for 1 round and deal double damage on the next attack.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the elixir is rumored to grant temporary invincibility, emboldening warriors before entering the arena.
DescriptionGame: Grants temporary HP, size, and strength.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing it bestows +2 to hit and damage for 5 turns, while doubling HP. Upon expiration, fumble die rolls are penalized with -1 until rest.

Lore: The Equinox is likely connected to the celestial bodies watched over by the Solari and Lunari of Mount Targon.
DescriptionGame: Deals damage to nearby enemies and reduces damage taken for a short duration after immobilizing an enemy champion.
DescriptionLore: Upon a foe's binding, nearby entities suffer 1d6 radiant damage. For the next turn, the wielder's armor class is improved by 2.

Lore: Implies a connection to ascended beings of Shurima, suggesting potential for transformation or enhanced power linked to the sun disc.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased vision range, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction to nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: Caster sees further; recovers mana as if drinking plentifully from a spring. Allies nearby act with greater speed and are less weary (reduce encumbrance category by 1). Grants +1 on saves versus charm effects.

Lore: Associated with the Solari, forging light into a protective ward. Perhaps a relic from a forgotten age on Mount Targon.
DescriptionGame: Provides health, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction. Grants an active shield to protect allies.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 AC. Once per day, emit a burst of light, granting all allies within 30' +1 AC for 1d4 rounds. Undead within range suffer disadvantage on attack rolls.

Lore: Forged on Targon, this item likely has connections to the Solari or the Rakkor, embodying protection and resilience.
DescriptionGame: Grants a shield to an ally and executes minions. Nearby allies heal for a percentage of damage taken.
DescriptionLore: Grants the wearer the ability to interpose before an ally, suffering blows in their stead. Additionally, when near death, the item may revitalize companions with transferred vitality.

Lore: Whispers say the Flicker was crafted by a forgotten order in Ionia, tied to the spirit realm and rapid translocation.
DescriptionGame: Briefly grants invulnerability and a short-range teleport.
DescriptionLore: Wearer vanishes in a puff of light, reappearing nearby. Save versus magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits. Grants +1 AC briefly after use.

Lore: May be related to Lissandra or another Ice Witch. Grants ghostly apparitions and slows foes.
DescriptionGame: Generates gold and mana regen. Active creates icy ghosts that seek enemies and slow them.
DescriptionLore: Upon utterance of the item's name, two incorporeal spectres are released to do the bidding of the wielder, chilling foes in their grasp and slowing them to a crawl. Lasts 1d4 rounds.

Lore: May be associated with Iceborn, wielding frozen power. Perhaps wielded by Lissandra's loyal followers or ancient Frostguard warriors.
DescriptionGame: Empowers auto attacks with an ice field that slows enemies and deals bonus damage.
DescriptionLore: On hit, target must save vs. frost or be slowed for 1 round. Once per day, wielder can unleash a blast of frost dealing 1d6 cold damage in a 10ft cone; save vs. cold for half.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, it whispers tales of ancient frost giants and forgotten winters.
DescriptionGame: Provides armor, mana, and cooldown reduction. Passively slows nearby enemies after using an ability.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 AC. After casting a spell, enemies within 10' must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment through secluded meditation and observation of the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Places a temporary invisible ward that reveals the surrounding area for a duration.
DescriptionLore: Grants brief invisibility and +4 to spotting hidden foes. Ward lasts 6 turns, revealing invisible creatures and traps within 30'. Save vs. magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits.

Lore: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be imbued with the spirits of ancient frost mages, forever seeking worthy warriors.
DescriptionGame: Empowers jungling with bonus damage to monsters and grants bonus gold. Chilling Smite slows enemy champions.
DescriptionLore: Inflicts 1d4 frost damage to beasts and grants +1 gold. A successful hit requires a DC 13 CON save or target suffers -2 to movement speed for 1 round.

Lore: Rumored to be recovered from a Sunken Temple of Nagakabouros, favored by fortune hunters and those seeking quick riches in the port cities.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health and provides bonus gold per 10 seconds. Upon death, the item is lost.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 HP. Every turn, roll 1d6. On a 6, gain 1 gold. If the wearer is reduced to 0 HP, the item crumbles to dust, and is lost.

Lore: Associated with Viktor and the Glorious Evolution, enhancing the user's mechanical capabilities. Commonly seen among Zaun's techmaturge.
DescriptionGame: Provides ability power, mana, and health. Can be upgraded into higher tier Hex Cores.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to hit with any mechanical device. User must save vs. magic or be compelled to 'improve' self with further modifications. Chance for mechanical limb failure.

Lore: Associated with early Noxian artificers, seeking to weaponize magic for the empire's expansion. Could be related to Mordekaiser's research.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic damage and an on-hit damage effect that heals the user.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, deal +1d4 magic damage, and heal 1hp. Rolls of 1 on the d4 cause a magical feedback dealing 1 damage to the user.

Lore: Likely used by foragers and hunters of the Freljord seeking to survive the harsh wilderness and monster encounters.
DescriptionGame: Restores health and mana over time while hunting monsters in the jungle.
DescriptionLore: Quaffing this potion heals 5 hit points per turn for 8 turns. Additionally, regain 1 spell slot if exhausted after the healing completes. Effects are negated by engaging in combat with other humanoids.

Lore: A draught favored by the Reckoners, rumored to be distilled from the blood of fallen gladiators. Enhances aggression and power.
DescriptionGame: On takedown, grants bonus attack damage, magic damage and movement speed for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Drink grants +2 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Afterwards, make a DC15 CON save or be overcome with exhaustion (-2 to all rolls) for 2d6 turns.

Lore: Forged by a forgotten Ionian sect, the Ionic Spark was used to defend against shadow magic. Now, only echoes of its power remain.
DescriptionGame: Deals chain lightning damage to nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Creature touched by spark must save vs. electricity or be stunned for 1 round. Nearby creatures have a 1 in 6 chance to be struck by chain lightning for 1d6 damage.

Lore: Favored by fortune tellers and gamblers across Bilgewater, believing it brought them luck in their ventures.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power and bonus gold per 10 seconds.
DescriptionLore: Bestow +1 on all luck checks. Anytime a '1' is rolled on a check, a ghostly visage appears, whispering secrets of upcoming trials for 1 round.

Lore: Forged in Ionia, rumored to enhance the life-stealing abilities of those who wield it, possibly tied to ancient Hemomancy practices.
DescriptionGame: On-hit, deals bonus magic damage equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health.
DescriptionLore: Creatures struck must SAVE vs. DEATH or suffer 1d4 permanent HP drain. The wielder heals the HP drained. Undead are immune.

Lore: Whispers claim it was forged in the Immortal Bastion, fueled by hemomancy. Its previous owners met gruesome ends, their life essence drained.
DescriptionGame: Damaging champions heals the wielder. Periodically deals damage to nearby enemies.
DescriptionLore: Heals 1d6 HP per round when near the dying. Adjacent foes suffer 1d4 damage (save vs. Death Ray). Wielder slowly becomes a ghoul.

Lore: Favored by Demacian rangers, this item enhances precision. Used by elite trackers.
DescriptionGame: Increased attack damage and critical strike chance. Grants bonus movement speed.
DescriptionLore: Ranger gains +1 to hit rolls at long range. On a critical hit, target must save vs. paralysis or be rooted for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by captains and sea monsters alike, the Leviathan was a sign of dominance on the high seas, often adorned with trophies.
DescriptionGame: Grants health based on kills and assists, lost upon death. Maximum of 30 stacks.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 max HP per foe vanquished (max 30). On death, lose 1d6 HP permanently. While at max stacks, attract the attention of krakens. Beware!

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial entities of Targon, offering protection against the harshest conditions.
DescriptionGame: Grants health regeneration and increased maximum health, enhancing survivability.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. death. Once per day, when reduced to 0 hit points, wearer is instead restored to 1d4 hit points.

Lore: Crafted by the legendary smith, Dominik, it is said to be blessed by the sun, allowing the wielder to pierce even the mightiest armor.
DescriptionGame: Grants armor penetration and bonus damage against champions with more health.
DescriptionLore: Attacks ignore AC, doing +1 damage per HD above the wielder (max +6). Undead & shadow creatures suffer double damage.

Lore: Resonates with the ancient magic of Ionia, amplifying the wearer's spells, reminiscent of a powerful echo mage.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power, mana, and movement speed. Damaging abilities grant charges, releasing chain lightning on the next hit.
DescriptionLore: Once per turn, after casting a spell, release a forking bolt of lightning dealing 1d6 damage for every 2 levels. Range: 30ft. Save vs. Magic to halve damage.

Lore: Associated with a Noxian artificer who sought to weaponize hemomancy. The item was lost after an experiment went awry.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus magic damage equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health on hit.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, the wielder siphons a portion of the target's life force dealing extra damage. The target must test against its Constitution or lose 1 point permanently.

Lore: Whispers say it was crafted in the Shadow Isles, fueled by tormented spirits, twisting minds and bodies alike. It is associated with corruption.
DescriptionGame: Dealing magic damage applies magic resist shred, reducing enemy defenses over time.
DescriptionLore: Curse: On a hit, victim saves vs. Wisdom or suffers -1 to AC vs. magic and -1 to saves vs. spells for 1d4 rounds. Cumulative.

Lore: Likely originating from the Shadow Isles, the Mandrake Ward could be associated with necromantic magic or entities manipulating perception and fear.
DescriptionGame: Reveals a target area, warning of approaching enemies, but disappears after use or after a duration.
DescriptionLore: Upon planting, the ward emits a psychic shriek audible only to creatures of ill intent within 30ft, imposing disadvantage on surprise attacks for creatures entering the area, fades after 1d4 turns.

Lore: Whispers speak of a pact made with dark entities, granting strength but risking demonic influence, potentially linked to Mordekaiser's dominion.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus AD, magic resist, and a shield when taking magic damage that would reduce the champion below a certain health threshold.
DescriptionLore: The bearer gains +3 to hit and damage rolls, and resists spells, but risks possession by a demon (save vs. magic or lose control!) upon taking lethal magic damage. Shield 1d6 damage.

Lore: Favored by captains navigating treacherous seas, it offers protection against curses and shadowy entities, common in the waters around Bilgewater.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage, magic resist, and a cleanse effect to remove crowd control.
DescriptionLore: Grants +2 to saves versus spells and paralysis. Once per day, may automatically break free from magical restraints or enchantments, as if by a Wish spell.

Lore: Forged by Ionian spiritwalkers, its illusions confuse foes, reminiscent of the trickster spirits of the forests, reflecting Ionian adaptability and misdirection.
DescriptionGame: On dealing damage, grants bonus move speed and creates a temporary, untargetable illusion near you.
DescriptionLore: Grants fleeting passage (2 in 6 chance) through enemy lines after striking; a duplicate appears at the point of attack, attracting a single blow before vanishing. Roll 1d6; on a roll of 1 or 2, the player is briefly incorporeal.

Lore: Said to be blessed by the celestial light of Targon, channeling the moon's restorative energies to aid allies in need.
DescriptionGame: Heals nearby allies when in combat, with the healing increasing over time.
DescriptionLore: Grants the wearer the ability to mend grievous wounds of those nearby. Each round, the mending becomes more potent. Chance for mended wounds to leave shimmering scars.

Lore: Whispers say Murksphere was used by a forgotten order in the Shadow Isles to contain malevolent spirits.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage and briefly grants movement speed when damaging an enemy champion.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, cast *Spirit Leech*. The target must SAVE vs. Magic or take 1d6 damage and you gain +1 to SPEED for 1 turn.

Lore: Said to be forged in the heart of the Shadow Isles, it pulses with the essence of tormented spirits, granting power at a terrible price.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus damage and movement speed on champion hit, with a cooldown and stacking mechanic.
DescriptionLore: Creature gains +1 to hit and damage. Upon striking a foe, creature must SAVE vs WIL or be compelled to move towards their target, even if unwise.

Lore: Favored by frost archers of the Freljord, Noonquiver aids in hunting massive beasts across the frozen tundra.
DescriptionGame: Grants increased attack damage and attack speed. Passively deals bonus damage to minions and monsters.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, deal +1d6 damage vs large or huge foes. Shots fired in dim light gain advantage. Spend 1 round to recover 1d4 arrows.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, it allows for swift strikes and ruthless efficiency in eliminating high-value targets.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed after damaging an enemy champion. Subsequent damage deals increased damage.
DescriptionLore: The user gains +2 to initiative. First successful attack deals +1d6 damage. Afterwards, the user must SAVE vs. WIS (DC 13) or be stunned 1 round by bloodlust.

Lore: Favored by those who seek hidden truths on Mount Targon. Used by the guides that explore the mountain's treacherous paths.
DescriptionGame: Temporarily reveals and disables nearby enemy wards and reveals hidden enemy traps.
DescriptionLore: As an action, see invisible creatures and objects within 90'. The effect lasts for 1 turn, and recharges after 1d4 turns. Invisible objects and creatures are not surprised.

Lore: Favored by duelists and those who value agility, the Phantom Dancer is often associated with Ionian martial traditions.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack speed, critical strike chance, and movement speed. Provides a shield when near death.
DescriptionLore: The wearer moves with unnatural speed (+2 to initiative). On taking a fatal blow, a spectral shield appears, negating the damage and allowing the wearer to flee (teleport 30'). Usable once per day.

Lore: Dwarven smiths in the Freljord use enchanted pickaxes to mine True Ice, the only substance capable of forging weapons strong enough to kill a god.
DescriptionGame: Grants additional attack damage, increasing the wielder's damage output.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking stone, a roll of 1-3 on a d6 results in uncovering a secret passage. A roll of 4-6 causes the stone to crumble, collapsing the tunnel in 1d4 turns.

Lore: Favored by Demacian soldiers, these boots offer protection against both physical blows and magical assaults.
DescriptionGame: Reduces incoming damage from basic attacks and increases armor.
DescriptionLore: Wearer suffers -2 to reaction rolls from loud clanking. Grants +1 AC against metal weapons and reduces damage from blunt weapons by 1 hp. If wearer is struck by magic, they are 20% likely to ignore it.

Lore: Favored by resourceful captains and cunning merchants to quickly redeploy ships and crews, or escape from dangerous waters.
DescriptionGame: Places a targetable teleport pad. Allies can use it to teleport to other pads after a short channel.
DescriptionLore: Creates a temporary magical portal. A second pad must be placed for it to function, allowing near instantaneous travel between the two points.

Lore: Likely used by early explorers of Shurima, seeking hidden tombs and resources beneath the sands. Perhaps belonging to a member of the Ascended.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus gold when near enemy structures. Reveals nearby wards.
DescriptionLore: User can sense the presence of precious metals and gems within 30', and detect magical wards. Roll Wisdom to locate, failure means a false reading.

Lore: Favored by Ionian archers seeking to strike with precision and speed, enhancing their ranged attacks.
DescriptionGame: Grants Energized attacks, providing bonus range and magic damage on the next attack.
DescriptionLore: Once per turn, +5 to hit with ranged weapons. If attack hits, deal +1d6 lightning damage and push target 5ft away.

Lore: Often found near spirit blossom festivals, rumored to contain essence from the spirit realm enhancing vitality.
DescriptionGame: Restores health over time. A simple and reliable sustain option.
DescriptionLore: Drinking restores 1d6 hit points per round for 10 rounds. If undead, suffer 1d4 damage per round for 5 rounds, then must save versus poison or be turned.

Lore: Associated with the Solari, celestial power is imbued within. Grants its user some of this godly strength.
DescriptionGame: Provides mana regeneration, ability haste, and bonus health to the wielder and nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: A character with this remnant regenerates MP at double rate, gains +1 AC. Once per day, heal all allies within 30' for 1d8 hit points.

Lore: Enhances the wearer's spells, perhaps linked to ancient Ionian spirit magic or forgotten techniques.
DescriptionGame: Periodically deals bonus magic damage to nearby enemies upon dealing ability damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per turn, after casting a spell, unleash a blast of pure energy. Deals 1d6 force damage to all creatures within 10ft. Save vs. spell or be stunned for 1 round.

Lore: Likely crafted by a hemomancer of Noxus, possibly connected to the Black Rose or Vladimir, focusing on blood magic.
DescriptionGame: Deals magic damage and heals the wielder. Damage increases based on bonus health.
DescriptionLore: Expend HP to deal arcane damage. Target creature bleeds for 1d4 rounds taking 1hp per round and healing the wielder for that amount.

Lore: Enchanted blade, imbued with spirit magic. Associated with Ionian monks seeking balance and harmony through martial prowess and arcane study.
DescriptionGame: Converts basic attack damage into magic damage on hit. Grants mana sustain and AoE magic damage.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, deal +1d6 magic damage. Regain 1 mana on successful attack. The first foe struck unleashes an arcane pulse dealing 1d4 magic damage to any nearby.

Lore: The compass may be related to ancient Freljordian navigation techniques or a relic of a lost tribe, possibly connected with Lissandra.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and mana regeneration based on proximity to an ally. Transforms into a different item after earning gold.
DescriptionLore: While near another, the wielder never lacks for coin or spell. Once enough wealth is gathered the compass leads to a place of power, upgrading the user. Chance of attracting unwanted attention.

Lore: Whispers say it was crafted by an ascetic order devoted to the stars, seeking to emulate celestial benevolence.
DescriptionGame: Provides a shield to allies who are nearby when you cast your ultimate.
DescriptionLore: Once per dawn, touch a grievously wounded ally to grant them temporary invulnerability. The savior suffers half the damage themselves; save versus death or be destroyed.

Lore: The pup's fiery claws hint at a connection to the volcanic vents deep within the Freljord. Perhaps it is related to a forgotten fire god.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage on next attack and applies a slow.
DescriptionLore: Next melee attack deals +1d6 fire damage and target suffers -2 to DEX saves for 1 round. Save vs. paralysis or be rooted to the spot.

Lore: Favored by Noxian admirals and generals, it represents strategic authority and martial strength, often seen in command tents or on flagships.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health, ability haste, and an active effect to boost nearby ally damage.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, issue a Command. Allies within earshot gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Undead and constructs are immune.

Lore: Favored by Noxian assassins, its design whispers of a tool crafted to dismantle Demacian battlemages' protective enchantments.
DescriptionGame: Deals bonus damage to enemy shields. Reduces enemy shield effectiveness for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: On hit, any magical warding is weakened, negating 2d6 points of protection and making the target easier to curse. May attract the attention of shieldmages.

Lore: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have belonged to a disgraced warlord, its magic offers resilience, but at a cost.
DescriptionGame: Grants ability power and armor, but reduces damage dealt as health decreases.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 to AC and +1 to magical attacks. As HP decreases, attacks deal -1 damage per 10% HP lost. Upon reaching 0 HP, the armguard shatters, dealing 1d6 magical damage to all within 5ft.

Lore: Said to amplify the will of the wielder, Shurelya's Requiem is rumored to originate from the Solari during a time of great need.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed and empowers allies with bonus damage on their attacks for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: Blast the Requiem. Allies within 30' move with haste, attacks deal +1 damage. Save vs. Spells or be stunned for 1 round after the effect ends due to psychic overload.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, Sightstones are imbued with celestial energy, granting vision where the mortal eye cannot perceive.
DescriptionGame: Periodically grants wards to place on the map, providing vision in a designated area for a limited time.
DescriptionLore: Functions as a spyglass revealing hidden threats and secret passages. User can cast 'clairvoyance' once per day; revealing a distant location on the map to the party, or can cast 'detect invisible' in a 30' radius.

Lore: Whispers say a hedge wizard in Ionia enchants boots for nimble students, granting bursts of speed. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order?
DescriptionGame: Slightly increased movement speed. Reduces the cost of upgraded boots.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves +10' per round. On a DEX save of 11+, boots reduce material cost of magical upgrades by 25% due to inherent enchantment.

Lore: Bound to restless spirits, it echoes the Shadow Isles' sorrow, perhaps linked to the Ruination or lost souls seeking solace.
DescriptionGame: Periodically grants a shield when near allies taking damage, then heals based on damage prevented.
DescriptionLore: Grants ephemeral protection to nearby allies, siphoning their injuries. Upon shield break, the wielder is revitalized by the transferred life force. Save versus Death at zero HP or become a shade.

Lore: Associated with restless spirits and the magic of the Shadow Isles, potentially used to siphon life force or manipulate spectral energies.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold and vision when damaging enemy champions. Transforms into Harrowing Crescent upon quest completion.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, the wielder leeches 1d4 HP, granting temporary sight beyond the veil. Upon leeching a total of 100 HP, it becomes the Harrowing Crescent, permanently granting the ability to see invisible foes.

Lore: Favored by those who siphon power from the weak, it may be associated with Lisandra's frostguard, or potentially even a tribe using dark ice.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus damage and gold on damaging spells and attacks against enemy champions. Disables gold generation when excessive CSing occurs.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking a foe, siphon their life force, gaining temporary vigor (+1 to hit) and wealth (1d6 cp). If you attack a minion or other creature beneath your notice, the edge dulls, and the effect ceases for 1 turn.

Lore: Associated with ancient Ionian monasteries, enhancing spiritual resilience and healing practices. Monks often use it to meditate and enhance their natural Ki.
DescriptionGame: Increases magic resist, health, and healing received. Boosts regeneration and shield effectiveness.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 on saves versus spells and doubles HP restored from any magical or medicinal source. Additionally, grants a +1 bonus to Wisdom checks related to healing or spiritual insight.

Lore: Associated with the now-defunct Stark family of Noxus, known for their brutal efficiency in warfare and their fervor in battle.
DescriptionGame: Aura grants attack speed and lifesteal to nearby allies, while reducing the armor of enemies.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to hit and damage rolls to allies within 30'. Enemies within range suffer -1 to AC. Bearer tests Will each round to avoid berserker rage (disadvantage on further Will saves).

Lore: Favored by Ionian monks and scouts, stealth wards allow for observation and protection.
DescriptionGame: Grants temporary vision of an area. Invisible to enemies.
DescriptionLore: Casts 'Eye of the Hidden Path.' Range: 120'. Duration: 1 Turn. Undetectable by normal means. Reveals creatures/objects within a 30' radius.

Lore: Whispers claim it channels celestial storms, favored by Aspect hosts seeking to overwhelm mortal foes. Connections to the Solari are suspected.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus magic damage on hit, and if the target dies you gain move speed.
DescriptionLore: Upon striking true, inflict an additional 1d6 lightning damage. If the target is slain, move an additional 1d4 hexes this turn. If wielder has Celestial blood, double damage and movement.

Lore: Forged with celestial energies, it might be tied to the Aspect of Twilight or constellations influencing fate. Champions who seek to fight gods would use it.
DescriptionGame: First attack after casting a spell crits, heals, and grants bonus armor penetration.
DescriptionLore: Guaranteed hit! Target takes double damage and must save versus CON or be stunned for 1 round. User heals 1d8 HP and gains +2 AC for 3 rounds.

Lore: Said to be forged from the light of a collapsing star. Prized by the Solari for its celestial power and connection to the Aspects.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus attack damage, attack speed and magic resist, increasing with consecutive attacks on champions.
DescriptionLore: Wielder gains +1 to hit and damage. On a successful attack, roll 1d6. On a 6, gain advantage on saving throws vs. spells and abilities for 1 round.

Lore: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the Brutalizer is a barbaric tool used to break down opponents. Said to have been forged in the Immortal Bastion's shadow.
DescriptionGame: Grants attack damage and armor penetration, enhancing physical damage output against armored foes.
DescriptionLore: Weapon deals +1d4 damage, ignores up to 2 points of AC from armor. On a critical hit, target's AC is permanently reduced by 1 (cumulative).

Lore: A parasitic entity from the Shadow Isles, possibly related to the Black Mist or a forgotten spirit. Feeds on the life force of its host.
DescriptionGame: Periodically leeches health from nearby enemies, granting it to the wielder and damaging the victim.
DescriptionLore: Bestow this wriggling horror upon a foe and steal 1d4 HP each round. On a fumble, the Parasite consumes you instead!

Lore: Likely crafted by an ancient Ice Witch, possibly Lissandra, its magic has faded with time, becoming a shadow of its former power.
DescriptionGame: Grants gold generation and ability power. Provides a bonus to mana regeneration and some health.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, touch the Frostfang to attempt to Freeze a target in place (Save vs. Magic). Grants +1 to cast magic missiles. Provides 1hp/level, and the holder can cast 'detect magic' once per day.

Lore: Possibly connected to an ancient Aspect or celestial being of Targon. Its age suggests a forgotten era of cosmic influence.
DescriptionGame: Grants movement speed, mana regeneration, and ability haste to nearby allies.
DescriptionLore: Upon activation, nearby party members receive +1 to their Speed factor and recover 1d4 mana per turn for the duration. Potential for catastrophic time paradoxes exists; GM discretion advised.

Lore: The elixir's ingredients are rumored to be sourced from the Spirit Blossom festival, enhancing magical prowess for a brief time.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus Ability Power for a short duration upon consumption.
DescriptionLore: Drink: Next magical attack deals +1d4 damage. Duration: 3 turns. Side effects may include uncontrollable giggling and seeing spirits.

Lore: Forged with ancient Ionian techniques, it is said to amplify the wielder's innate abilities. Associated with the spirit realm.
DescriptionGame: Empowers abilities after use, grants bonus damage, attack speed and movement speed.
DescriptionLore: On a hit, if the user just cast a spell, roll +Level, on a success, deal +1d6 damage, +1 to speed and attacks for 3 rounds. On a fumble take 1d4 spirit damage.

Lore: Likely created in Zaun by Viktor or one of his followers. It appears to be a Hextech device modified with unique chemicals.
DescriptionGame: Empowers a champion to charge at enemies, dealing damage and creating a damaging nova after a short delay.
DescriptionLore: Wearer can make one devastating charge attack per encounter, dealing 2d6 damage to all within 10ft on impact. Afterwards, the wearer risks losing control (50% chance) for 1 round.

Lore: Legends say a tempestuous spirit was bound within it by a forgotten Ionian sect, granting the wielder incredible speed and agility.
DescriptionGame: On hit, grants movement speed and bonus damage. Stacks up to three times.
DescriptionLore: Grants +1 to initiative and allows an extra attack. However, after 3 rounds, requires a DC 15 WIS save or become winded (-1 to hit for 1 round).

Lore: Favored by those who dance among the stars, granting ethereal lightness and swiftness to reach ever higher celestial realms.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus movement speed and allows the holder to move unhindered through units.
DescriptionLore: Wearer moves as if weightless, ignoring difficult terrain. Chance to float upwards when still; roll a d6. On a 6, ascend 10' per round until landing or action is taken.

Lore: Crafted in Demacia, rumored to ward against rogue mages or creatures of the void. The barrier instills courage against magical threats.
DescriptionGame: Grants magic resistance and ability power, absorbing incoming magic damage with a shield.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. magic and a 1-time shield of 1d8 hp vs. magical attacks. Shield recharges after a full day of rest. Detect magic cast upon the wearer has a 25% chance of failing.

Lore: Used by Demacian scouts to maintain vigilance against Sylas' mageseekers. Also favored by Garen's Dauntless Vanguard for reconnaissance.
DescriptionGame: Grants vision of an area, revealing invisible units and wards. Lasts until destroyed.
DescriptionLore: Creates an invisible, immobile sensor. Detects illusions, magical creatures and the invisible. Easily dispelled by magic or a strong wind. Range: 30 ft.

Lore: Forged in the heart of Noxus, imbued with relentless aggression. Favored by Darius, it amplifies martial prowess and dominance on the battlefield.
DescriptionGame: Bonus attack damage and increased regeneration after champion takedowns.
DescriptionLore: Confers +1 to hit and damage. After slaying a foe, regain 1d4 hit points. A failed save vs. fear after combat may result in aggressive outbursts.

Lore: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian executioners, rumored to be stained with the essence of countless betrayals and dark pacts.
DescriptionGame: Dealing physical damage grants stacking attack damage and movement speed for a short duration.
DescriptionLore: On hit: target must SAVE vs DEATH or be reduced to 0 hp and fall to pieces! On a successful save, wielder gains +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Likely crafted by the Iceborn, it resonates with the magic of the Freljord and is tied to increasing one's resilience and defense.
DescriptionGame: Grants mana, armor, and ability haste. Absorbs damage, and transforms into Fimbulwinter upon reaching a certain mana threshold.
DescriptionLore: Wearer gains +2 AC and +1 to hit rolls against cold-based attacks. If the wearer's HP is reduced to 0, a barrier of ice forms, granting them temporary invulnerability but inflicting Exhaustion afterwards.

Lore: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, amplifying bonds between allies and echoing ancient pacts.
DescriptionGame: Grants bonus health and ability power; heals nearby allies when casting or taking damage.
DescriptionLore: Heal 1d6 hit points to all allies within 30ft when you expend a spell slot or take more than 5 damage in a single turn. Usable 3 times per day.

Lore: Said to ward off spirits, Wriggle's Lantern was once used by sentinels to navigate the Shadow Isles. It is now lost.
DescriptionGame: Provides attack damage, armor, life steal, and a chance to ward on attack.
DescriptionLore: Lantern allows sight through magical darkness, +1 AC, and drains 1 HD worth of life force from anything struck by the wielder's melee attacks.

Lore: Worn by elite Kinkou Order trainees. Enhances agility and grounding, essential for maintaining balance in spiritual and physical combat.
DescriptionGame: Reduces the duration of slows. Grants tenacity, reducing the duration of crowd control effects.
DescriptionLore: Wearer ignores difficult terrain. +1 save vs. spells affecting movement or balance. A failed save causes disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 round.

Lore: Likely tied to the spirit of Youmuu, a restless soul haunting the Shadow Isles, seeking vengeance.
DescriptionGame: Provides lethality and movement speed, increasing damage and mobility.
DescriptionLore: Wearer becomes harder to hit (-2 AC), moves faster (+10' movement), and deals +2 damage to those who have wronged them. But attracts spectres that drain 1 HP per turn.

Lore: Favored by Ionian duelists valuing swiftness, embodying balance between speed and precision, reflecting Ionian martial philosophies.
DescriptionGame: Increases movement speed and critical strike chance.
DescriptionLore: Bestows +1 to initiative and a +1 bonus to hit when charging or retreating. Once per day, reroll a missed attack roll.

Lore: Potentially forged by the Ice Witch, or granted to followers of the Three Sisters. Grants frost powers.
DescriptionGame: Binds you and an ally, granting bonus damage on attacks and slowing enemies you attack.
DescriptionLore: The wearer can cast "Frost Armor" on an ally. AC is improved by 2, and melee attackers must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed for 1d4 rounds.

Lore: Presumably crafted by, or in honor of, the ancient Shuriman artificer, Zhonya. In theory, it's a device that can stop time.
DescriptionGame: Renders the champion invulnerable and untargetable for a short duration, but prevents them from taking actions.
DescriptionLore: User becomes immune to all damage but is turned to gold and cannot act. Lasts 2d4 combat rounds. Requires DC 18 WIS save to activate, on failure, target is turned to gold permanently.

Lore: Likely tied to ancient Shuriman constructs or void-touched experiments gone awry. May be a relic of the Rune Wars.
DescriptionGame: Periodically spawns Voidspawn to push lanes. Grants bonus armor and magic resist near turrets.
DescriptionLore: Once per day, summon a CR 1/2 Voidling that lasts 1d4 turns. While within 30' of a structure, gain +2 AC and +2 to saves vs. magic.
